description: Came here during pride weekend for a dinner date. We were seated quickly in more of the tighter booths but we didn't mind. I love their house red wine. We ordered a mini carafe which is a good size if you just need a few drinks before hitting the bars. I got the alfredo which was SO GOOD. I love the flavor of the red pepper sauce. Tastes fresh and it wasn't too thick or watery. My date got the spaghetti and meatballs which comes with three HUGE meatballs cooked to perfection.
author: Patricia T.

description: Quirky fun decor and menu. Quality pasta, sauces, and food. Good portion size. Nice servers.
author: Christopher L.

description:
I love this place! I went last weekend for the first time and went back again last night because it was just that good. 

Emmy's has a laid back vibe and eclectic decor. It's a popular place, so you might need to wait a bit for a table if you just walk in, but it's easy to book a reservation online. The first time we went we snagged seats at the bar where you can order food too, which is great for times when the wait for a table is long. 

The drink menu has a great selection of cocktails and draft/bottled beers, but I've stuck with the house red when I've visited. It's reasonably priced at $8 per glass and pairs well with the flavors of the food. 

Everything is delicious, but the standout dish is the spaghetti and meatballs. The pasta is perfectly cooked, the meatballs are flavorful and large, and the marinara sauce has a nice flavor and texture. It's also a huge portion. My boyfriend and I split it with an extra meatball on the side (it comes with 3, so this made 4) and were both very satisfied. The zoodles were also really good if you're looking for something healthier or less carb-intensive!

Definitely a great neighborhood spot that is worth checking out!
author: Christine G.

description: We go the Ceaser which was excellent, linguini, spaghetti and meatballs, mussels and garlic bread. Food was great. Shared a bottle of sparkling rosé with the four of us. For what this is, a fun Italian spot in the city we were happy, would come back here if in the area although not our first choice.
author: Elliott O.

description: Wanted to check this place out for years and was not disappointed once I finally did. Tasty, large portions of pasta. Awesome decor and atmosphere. Service was good. Had to take a lot of food home, but pasta leftovers are a favorite of mine, so it was a good thing to have some extra for later consumption. I will be back for sure.
author: Rise G.

description:
I've been going here for over 10 years and the food is as delicious as the first time I visited. Friendly staff, simple but delicious menu. What more could you ask for?

If you want no-nonsense comfort food at decent prices, then Emmy's is your place!
author: Joe B.

description:
The place was very crowded when I first walked in on a Saturday at 7 PM; could barely fit into the door. I think this was a temporary blip though; it seemed like a bunch of tables had opened up at once and it was just a matter of getting people seated. You can and should make reservations through Yelp to be safe.

The half-booth seating (there are full booths for larger parties) puts you pretty close with other tables as is the norm with that type of seating. For this reason, it probably isn't great for an early date (before you're comfortable with each other) or if you're the type who is very uncomfortable in that type of seating. Again, nothing abnormal for city restaurants.

The only minor "complaint" is that the initial greet/drink order took a while (one of those times where you're ready to order everything by the time the server comes around), but I don't get bent out of shape about that and neither should you!

The fried cauliflower mozzarella was good as expected. We both ordered spaghetti and meatballs (as did the couple next to us) and were very happy with it. I have some leftover waiting for me for dinner tonight. It rivals a lot of the homemade spaghetti/meatballs I've had and is the best I can remember having at a restaurant.

I had a Chianti which was good as well. We didn't order dessert so no report there unfortunately.

Highly recommended when you're in the mood for spaghetti and meatballs (can't speak for the rest yet!).
author: J.P. M.

description:
This is such an edgy place. It's not your traditional Italian restaurant but it's very good. I had the linguini past with clams and Spanish chorizo. It was very good. The pasta was al dente and not over cooked. 

The only thing I didn't like was the complementary bread. It gives low expectations of the food that is going to be served.
author: Mariana V.

description: Behold- this is exactly what spaghetti is supposed to taste like! It was delicious and filling, with portions to share. Great pricing. Good, quirky atmosphere. Friendly staff. Family friendly. Go get some good spaghetti!
author: Sam D.

description: This was our first time at their new location & they haven't lost an ounce of their kitschy appeal that helped put their name of the map. Their claim to fame -- spaghetti (noodles aren't too al dente which I like) & (3 huge, moist, flavor-packed) meatballs -- tastes even better the next day; not that we even had room to take more than two bites after appetizers of prawn ceviche & brussel sprouts. Food is lovingly made, service is brought to you by friendly neighborhood hipsters, & now there's a photo booth & arcade to add entertainment to dinner. Emmy's, don't you ever change (unless it's for the better.)
author: Fancypants X.

description:
We came here for dinner and loved everything, although it was packed and it took a long time to be seated. The table were very close.
They brought us some toast with olive oil.
Then we split a very good Caesar salad.
For the main course, my partner had the flank steak which he said was tender and perfectly prepared. They also brought us some tasty garlic bread.
Because Emmy's specializes in spaghetti, I had the spaghetti marinara which was delicious.
author: Philip C.

description: If you have an appetite them you're in the right spot. The plate sizes are quite big. So price to portion ratio is excellent. Even the shrimp ceviche appetizer was pretty big. Just be aware the walk in wait time can be an hour so make reservations. We got seated right away because of it. Service is pretty quick. They're spaghetti and meatballs is their most popular dish, but it wasn't as flavorful as I expected. Their food is good but not great. I would still come back here to try their other items cause I'm curious and/or if I'm really hungry and in the mood for Italian. Overall I'm satisfied
author: Alex L.

description: I think I'm at a solid 3.5 stars. It's really loud - think the real Mission of bars - but the meatballs are on point! The cauliflower fried cheese balls were amazing too! I was thinking they'd be a healthy app option- they aren't - but they are so worth the calories.
author: Leina K.

description: This place is a quirky dive.  And I loved it!  Service was fast and friendly.  I am a picky spaghetti eater, I always order it but rarely think it was good.  My pasta was properly cooked, sauce was flavorful but not over flavored, and the meatball.  OH THE MEATBALL.  It was an amazing texture, tender with great flavor.   I started with one (because I'm a light eater and back to the picky bit) and ended up with three before dinner was done.  We had the doughnut for dessert and it did not disappoint.  I can't wait to go back!
author: Dawn B.

description: You had me at spaghetti and shack. Daughter: "as you walk in you are overwhelmed with beautiful decorations. At the back there are two vintage pinball machines and a Pac-Man/DigDug/Donkey Kong combo machine. Meatballs are big and delicious. You can order an extra side of sauce that goes perfectly with the meatballs and pasta."
author: dan b.

description: Great atmosphere and real friendly. Food is amazing and the menus are written in crayons.
author: David B.

description:
Make reservations now! Everything we had was so delicious. Spaghetti and meatballs, zoodles, cheesy garlic bread, and mozzarella cauliflower bites. Pear shack mules all around! 

Great service, awesome food and ambiance. I don't blame you for getting out of your seat to dance!
author: Nikki N.

description:
This is his story, not mine but I'm going to tell you anyway. Ten years ago, he was younger, childless, and free. He had the absolute freedom to do anything and everything he wanted and this was the place he hang out the most often, besides that bar, which was at the time, owned by a local celebrity with an odd name and picture still painted on the side of the wall, not far from here. There was a woman, who he dated, she was a roommate to the bar owner. She lived nearby and she was in love with him. He would dine and wine her in this restaurant, in its prior location, sometimes several times a week. It was a place filled with eclectic decorations, a little kitsch, a little spunk, plenty of visual entertainment. The food was filling and good, and the price was good. 

He had not been here for many years and not before it closed and moved. He was delighted that it reopened, so on one evening he invited me here. To be quite honest, I think he invited himself here and I was there to listen to his stories. I think he needed to tell someone about his past, when he was good looking, younger, flush with money, incredibly driven, had his own tech firm, and he absolutely cornered the artist / bookish / creative types of women all over town. The list of women grew over the years and no one could seem to let go of him, because he was aloof  but he took great care of each relationship, paid great compliments to these ladies and treated them to meals in places like this, very good food, not gonna to break your bank, great service by friendly servers, and incredibly easy to spend a hour or two enjoying your food while admiring the decorative art on the wall. It was an atmospheric restaurant with good booth seating. It's both date and family friendly. And the menu looked like a little kids wrote it, in crayon style print. All in all, a winner.

He asked me what prompts me to write Yelp reviews. I told him that only if the food was good and the experience was memorable. I almost never write bad reviews. I eat out lots, and I don't always check in nor write reviews. It would need to pique my interest for me to check in and it would made a positive impression for me to write about it. I don't want to invite bad karma. I added.

I think restaurants like this became a San Francisco institution. It is often the young who write reviews, but it's the middle age men and women who remember the city as their playground to come back to places like this, to reminisce, to fall in love again with their memories of the past. 

Perhaps the greatest strength and weakness for me is the sense of detachment. I enjoyed going out on occasion to eat with old friends because they can unload on me, and I'd show great empathy, and I listen intensely to their stories. Later on, I might write about them but too often the only thing that motivates me to write about any place is the food, and not the stories they told me. In that way, I'm very much like my almost 2 year old St. Barnard and Golden Retriver mix, Abby, I'm very motivated by food, and memories of the food. The stories were often just decorations.

I remembered that evening, as he told me stories about these women, one particular lady who lived near here, his voice filled with regret and longing, longing for a past that he so dearly needed to hold on, as it was the best decade of his life and filled with so much potential. Yet it fleeted so ever quickly. I was busy eating my plate of food as he told me stories after stories. And when my plate was done, I eyed his greedily, "Are you going to finish your spaghetti and meatballs?" He said no, and I cleaned his plate. It was finger licking delicious.
author: Victoria E.

description: Really great spaghetti.  Funky atmosphere and super cool staff.
author: Kris F.

description: My husband and I visited this little restaurant for dinner on our first trip to San Francisco. It was really good. Only complaint I have is the hostess was pretty rude but our food was delicious and good portions for the price. I would recommend trying if you're craving Italian food!
author: Riley M.

description: The food is good here.  However, we got our entrees right after our salad came and we were totally bummed.  It's not that hard to fire things in the kitchen in sequential order and not all at once.  We were forced to turn to eating our entrees because we didn't want them to get cold.  You also are told no substitutions on the menu.  I mean, I get it, but come on.  If I'm eating at a sit down type of place then I at least expect things to be coursed out properly.  Pretty disappointed...
author: Jesus H.

description:
Unpretentious (un·pre·ten·tious) --an adjective whose definition is:
not attempting to impress others with an appearance of greater importance, talent, or culture than is actually possessed.

Get prepared to walk into a San Francisco original.  No attitude allowed please.  All are welcome to peruse their graffiti inspired menus while a Pandora play list blares from the overhead speakers.  

Dimly lit with what looked like outdoor deck lights strung with vintage aprons overhead, you'll sit in vinyl booths set against red walls covered with painted canvasses of SF memorabilia.

Your tattooed server will immediately bring you a small plate of focaccia bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar for dipping.

We opted to get the 40oz bottle of Budweiser to share while we munched on the cheesy garlic bread that we ordered to start.  Our server, Laura, was excellent!!  Such a sweetie--great sense of humor too.

I couldn't resist ordering the plate that they are famous for--- spaghetti and meatballs.  The menu reads " 3 big balls" are included.

My partner ordered the orechiette with pancetta, asparagus and an Asiago cream sauce.

Three stars for the food. They really do try.  There's a nice wine list too.

Dessert was an "okay" cinammon donut with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream.  It presented well but the donut tasted a few days old.....

If you want to experience a hipster, Mission, "cool" place with great service and nice people, then head on out to Emmy's Spaghetti Shack.
author: Thomas D.

description:
First time. Finally made it in!

20 minute wait? No worries. Hang out in the back. Pinball machine, pac-man and photobooth! 
Spend $1.00 on the pinball machine for 3 plays...holy crap. It lasts forever! :D Or you can go outside for some fresh air. 

Food = Good. 

Garlic bread = fresh garlic, olive oil and parsley on ciabatta. Delicious. Over the top garlic. 3 pieces $4.00. 

Side sauce = saucy and tart goodness. $2.00

Green Goddess salad = mixed lettuces with organic quinoa, cut snap peas, avocado, goat cheese and Emmy's green goddess dressing. Refreshing, crisp, and addicting. So glad we tried this instead of my usual go-to Cesar. $10.00

Emmy's spaghetti and meatballs = heaping plate of spaghetti and 3 large beef meatballs, topped with fresh parmesan and parsley. Piping hot, perfectly cooked pasta, and tender, juicy beef meatballs. $14.95 x2

Can of Coke = $2.50

Shirley Temple = large, $2.50 

Service = friendly. Attentive enough. 

Seating = mixture of bar seating, 2-tops, 4-tops, and a 6-top. I'm sure creative organizing can accommodate bigger parties. 

Ambiance = eclectic. Aprons, snarky signs galore, Siamese lamp with red eyes, dim lighting throughout (but your seating area is well lit), red lights, hand-drawn menus, chalk scribbles, etc.  It is noisy AF in here, and you will rub elbows with your dining neighbors.  

Prices = moderate. Dinner for two came out to $55.35, with leftovers. 

Parking = street. Free after 6 p.m. but takes a while to find. $12.00 parking is at Bank of America lot, after banking hours.  Do public transit if you can. 

Oh, and this is a dinner only place. Sunday to Thursday 5 p.m. to 10 p.m., and Friday and Saturday 5 p.m. to 11 p.m. (Reservations via Yelp.)
author: Fannie S.

description: LOVE Emmy's!! It's our go-to place...food is always good, service always friendly, love the space (so fun and cozy)...did I say I loved it?!
author: Aimee M.

description: Not sure what the hype is all about. Yeah, it's eclectic with a photo booth, pinball machine and video game in the back, along with the interesting decor. But the food is not up to SF standard in taste. Seems like they focused more on quantity, rather than quality, so it's economical for families with kids. The complimentary bread with oil/vinegar dip was mediocre, and the garlic cheese bread was not any better. My seafood pasta was light and refreshing, but it lacked umami. I ordered a separate serving of meatballs to see what the fuzz was all about. Sadly, I am still left wondering.
author: Calforever C.

description: This place was so bomb. They even had vegan options. I left high on spaghetti. I would definitely return next time I need a pasta fix. They had a couple pinball games in there too. Come here if you want to get twisted. #sendnoods
author: Adam M.

description:
Fabulous dinner as always! Emmy's is delicious and fun. We ate dinner during family hour and our son enjoyed looking at and touching the pinball and video game console while my wife and I enjoyed amazing desserts. 
Cheesy garlic bread, green goddess salad, eggplant parm, kids' spaghetti with butter, and orchiette pasta in a creamy sauce... All tasted great. I love their classic spaghetti & meatballs but everything's a winner.
author: Michael S.

description:
Normally I would give Emmy's a 4, but last night, we went out for dinner and specifically because of our experience with Nicky and Kelly, we give it a 5!

My wife and I have been coming here for over 5 years, including its previous location. We walked in last night and it was busy. Nicky asked if we had a reservation - we actually never knew you could make reservations!  Now we know. She put our name down on the list and said the wait would be about an hour. Before the hour was up, the table was ready. You could tell the restaurant was understaffed and Nicky was hustling like crazy and maintaining her composure. Frankly, she is the nicest hostess we've ever had at Emmy's. This is a superstar move to have her on your team. 

Kelly was our waitress and she couldn't have been more pleasant. Just a very nice lady - very attentive to us and kept checking on us. Because they were understaffed, things were moving very quickly but we never felt rushed. Before we could ask for another carafe of water it was on our table. I am totally impressed with these two ladies. 

The food speaks for itself. We had the spaghetti, garlic bread, and roasted cauliflower mozzarella balls. Great, simple food. We will of course return, but this time we may check to be sure Nicky and Kelly are working before we do!
author: Yatin P.

description: I can't say enough great things about this place! Super duper family friendly, where Mondays and Tuesdays your kiddos eat free from 5-7. The signature dish, spaghetti and meatballs, is our go to, but many of their other pasta dishes are excellent as well. Staff is super friendly and accommodating...
author: Erin C.

description:
We were coming back from an art event on Saturday night and were looking for something quick and filling in the area. Thankfully, Emmy's was open late enough (11pm) and we were able to get sat immediately. We were cutting it pretty close (it was about 10:15), but the host and server didn't seem too annoyed by our late arrival. There were still a lot of people still eating, and the vibe was loud and lively. They were playing top 40 rap from the 90's and everyone, including the servers, were singing and dancing. We got sat at a booth in the middle of the restaurant and were given created, handwritten menus that were fun to read. 

We all ordered wine and beer (I thought their wine by the glass list was pretty diverse) and an order of the cheesy garlic bread. After a couple of bites, I had to give away my slices; the raw garlic is so intense that I knew I'd be reeking of garlic if I took any more bites. We all kept pointing out tasty-sounding dishes (so basically all of them) on the menu, but when it came time to order, we all went for the spaghetti and meatballs. I had been told in the past not to expect real Italian food, but I thought the meatballs tasted super authentic and the sauce was really good too! The portion size was more than generous and each order came with three large meatballs. I definitely took home a decent amount at the end of the meal. The bill was reasonable and it was a great way to end the evening (we were all too full to keep drinking afterwards). The restaurant is a truly unique place that is great for groups, and I will be sure to return.
author: Regina L.

description: I wanted to love Emmy's. It has the quirkiness and funk that I expect from a restaurant this far up on Mission. But the meatballs were so so. They were light, but mealy. That leads me to believe the meat is too lean, and there's probably more breadcrumbs than meat in the mix. The pasta was drowned in sauce and the sauce lacked depth of flavor. It wasn't bad. But it wasn't great either. The waitresses are fun and welcoming, so I would recommend it for a date night.
author: William B.

description:
So good. Everything about this place can be summed up as just that. The ambience, the ability to reserve a table online, the waitstaff, the menu, the drinks..so good. 

Unfortunately, I don't think I'll ever be able to eat anything other than the spaghetti and meatballs-even though everything on the menu looks incredible, I couldn't tear myself away from my generous carbohydrate feast, and when I looked around, every single table around us had ordered the same thing. Keep up the excellent work!
author: Kate M.

description:
Perfect date place or bring your family place. Plus they serve crabbies' ginger beer!

I liked coming on a date to this place. I ordered a salad and it was good. The vibes are great here as is the service.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Loved every part of the meal. The house red was nice, the salad was fresh and interesting. The spaghetti and meatballs was clearly popular so I decided to try it. Some of the best out there and a big portion too. 

The decor and staff were both chill and nice. Will definitely be back at some point!
author: Chris M.

description: I've been a fan and patron of Emmy's since their days up Mission at their original location. Food and service was great then, just as it is now.
author: William A.

description:
Got it delivered and it was very good.

Spaget with meatballs, I know, not authentic but who cares? It was yummy and there were 3 balls. When was the last time you saw that?

Well composed sauces, very nice pasta (not to thick/thin) and well stuffed.

As were we. Well done!
Enjoy!
author: William M.

description: Really fun place! It all starts with uber-cute menus, in handwritten style. The star of the show here is spaghetti with meatballs. I came with two friends: they both had spaghetti with meatballs, and I had pappardelle with pulled pork. Everything was great, but I'm getting the meatballs next time! We also got a bottle of vino verde as well as a delicious "OMG PB Bar" dessert. I will definitely be back here.
author: Aviah M.

description:
We pushed our original reservations back 45 minutes - done without a problem.  It just so happened that we ended up arriving 15 minutes early - our table was ready and we were seated without a problem.  They knew we were coming with 2 young children and so I appreciated how they accommodated us (and the rest of the patrons) by sitting us against the back wall.  That was very comfortable for the kids, for us and we stayed out of sight and out of mind of the other diners.  The kids were given crayons and coloring sheets and were made to feel welcomed.  By the way, kids eat free on Mondays and Tuesdays, a definite plus.  Bread/vinegar/oil was served to us almost immediately and turnaround time on the entrees was quick as well.  Food was simple yet full of flavor and intricacies.  Hearty.  Home cooked comfort yet at the same time the quality and depth reminded me that I was at a San Francisco restaurant.  If I am "required" to cite one negative is that the wine list was a little over priced weighted against the quality, but minor details.  Overall, I would put Emmy's Spaghetti Shack in the category of restaurants where I would take out of town guests, which was the case here (Sister and Brother in law visiting from Hawaii).

Highly recommended dishes:  Spaghetti and Meatballs.  Mayan Risotto.
author: Paul G.

description:
OHHH MY HOLY MEATBALLS!

WOW!!! 

This place is small and FULL.  Apparently, everyone knows abt this place.
The night before we were just chillin' at my brothers place watching "24hours of gluttony" these two Asian guys eating at 24 places in 24 hours.  The episode we watched was of course the SF.  I saw they stopped by this place, and HAD to come here and check out the meatballs!
Boy, was I amazed! Homemade spaghetti with meatballs the size of a tennis ball! So flavorful and YUMMY!!!
Even though the wait was long, it was sure worth it!
We also ordered a bottle of sangria, Stuffed jalapeño peppers and for dessert the OMG Peanut butter bar! 
EVERYTHING is DELICOUS!!! 
Our waitress was awesome also!!!
author: Remie M.

description: Popular old-school SF place. Used to be hyped, and now a standard bearer. Solid hearty homemade italian. Meatballs and sauce are delicious. Zoodles are good too. Table was weirdly snug. And, service was New Jersey surly. Hate places that don't do substitutions.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Since they moved, the prices went up. Also, on our visit the booths were so tiny my chest sat on the tabletop and if I'd been a pant size larger probably wouldn't have fit at all. Turns out the benches do move, but the booths on either side were seated already so we had to adjust ALL of them in order to give us a couple more inches of breathing room. 

Pretty kid-friendly atmosphere, for better or worse. While I think there need to be places for families to go out, we kinda rushed through our dinner because of a particularly fussy/shrieky infant a couple tables over. 

But it's still a filling meal for ~$20 pp if you skip booze or appetizers. 

On the plus side, the meatballs are still delicious and they take reservations now!
author: Krista L.

description: The spaghetti and meatballs is fantastic!  We also had the pappardelle was tasty though needed a touch of sweet - I thought.  The pasta is fresh made and you can tell.  Wine is expensive.  Make a reservation at this place.  We were there on a Tuesday and it was constantly busy.  I would pass on the cheesy garlic bread but go for the mozzarella balls with the marinara dipping sauce.
author: Diana T.

description: The first time I went here I ordered what think were called "zoodles". It was a pasta made out of zucchini, and if anyone could actually make that taste good, they did. But look at every other table. Spaghetti and Meatballs. Maybe some (very good) garlic bread. If you order anything else, I'm sure it's good. But why? Their spaghetti is an amazing thing that can't be ignored. Even without the (freaking delicious) meatballs. A humble dish perfected. And I mean PERFECTED!
author: Bill C.

description: Came for an early dinner with our 18 month old daughter. She was welcomed with a high chair and her own menu--a rarity in the city. Good food and very nice service.
author: Kate B.

description: Cute ass spot for a date. They got a janky photo booth in the back and the whole aesthetic of the restaurant is old school and punky- I love the aggressive witty women that work here. Food was bomb as well
author: Tuionesia O.

description: Was pretty excited to try this place because I love spaghetti and meatballs. Love it together and without. Emmy's is a super cute and charming place. Even the menu is super cute and colorful. But the dishes we order wasn't amazing. Not saying it was not good but its just okay. The spaghetti and meatballs was really good but there isn't a wow factor. The garlic bread was good and a nice addition to the pasta dish.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Totally fell in love with this little joint. Fun interior, great drinks and even better pasta.

The risotto is a must! So incredibly creamy, flavorful and there's a good heat from the habanero peppers. 

Also tried the spaghetti and meatballs as well as the linguini which was quite delicious.

The fried mozzarella balls were ok but not a must order.

Can't wait to bring my friends and family here to take pics in photo booth, have a drink and slurp up some pasta!
author: Kathleen O.

description: I've been eating a Emmy's for over a decade. Sad to report that the quality has gone down hill. It used to be a place for comfort food prepared by and for foodies. Now, it's no better than chain restaurant quality, if that. I went last night and had their classics. Spaghetti and meatballs and Caesar salad. The Caesar dressing was bland and mayonnaise-y. Croutons were stale. The meatballs has a lot of filler and were too soft. Spaghetti was over cooked. Sauce lacked a vibrant tomato flavor. Cheese which used to be real parm was some cheap stuff. I won't go back, which is sad for me to say after so many visits over the years. Emmy's had a real place in the SF  restaurant world that was both high quality and fun. But they've lost their way.   :m
author: Robert F.

description: The garlic cheese bread was really good, but the spaghetti & meatballs were bland, fettuccini was okay at best & the linguini with clams was terrible (I sent it back- something I have never done)... a lot of ppl were raving about this place, maybe I've just been spoiled with amazing Italian food.
author: Melissa B.

description:
Oh my god do I LOVE this place! I had my birthday here back in October and got all my friends hooked! It is a little pricey for pasta but the portions are huge and taste so amazing! The mixed drinks are terrific too! You can't go wrong with their traditional spaghetti and meatballs (when they say big balls THEY MEAN IT). 
I recommend if you have a party bigger than 2 people to make a reservation because they do get pretty busy and packed after a certain time, especially on weekends!
author: Mandy F.

description:
This spaghetti shack is really close to my temporary living situation in the Mission, so we walked here for dinner one night.

The place is small, so if you arrive late, you risk not having a table. It was a friendly neighbor hood joint. 

There are many spaghetti options on the menu, but my bf and I shared the spaghetti and meatballs and a grilled pear salad. The food was solid, but nothing mind blowing. 

What I found slightly annoying is that they make no substitutions, so I couldn't switch the blue cheese in my salad out for goat cheese. They also charge additional for extra pieces of house bread (which you only get a few very small pieces to begin with). Not that I was going to ask for extra, but seeing that on the menu was slightly annoying. 

It's a good place for families with children, as children get to eat for free before 7PM on weekdays!
author: Cynthia X.

description:
Finally tried this place with friends last night. 

Service was terrific with friendly servers all around. 

Ambiance was chill and spacious in this former Zócalo location. 

Food was solid homestyle Italian-American.  Iffa yooa crayvinga trua Italian cookinga thena yooa musta goa tooa Capannina onna Union Streeta. 

Thinka Primo anda Secondo in Big Night.
author: Anthony D.

description:
So much for my low carb diet. Friends brought me here and since I hadn't been, everyone recommended their classic spaghetti and meatballs. First thought: HUGE portion size. I eat a lot, and this was easily good for 2-3 meals. I gave my leftovers to a homeless guy, because since we have none in Orange County, it made me feel altruistic and fuzzy on the inside. But I digress.

The food was good. The fried cheese ball app thingy was decadent, the main course was very good (and very clearly made with butter), and the donut dessert was honestly mediocre. Service was friendly and a bit sassy, which was fine. All in all, nothing totally blew me away, but very good food besides the dessert.
author: Akshay A.

description:
Spaghetti is my favorite meal. Thank you so much for not f'ng it up but actually making me feel like all others I've tried have been failed attempts.

Emmys is fantastic. I love everything about it except that I didn't find it sooner. Service is on point. The servers are friendly and fun. The table next to us had a family with kids and that had someone dressed up like Santa doing balloon animals.

He was incredibly sweet.

The local art on the walls is amazing and I considered buying a piece while I was there. 

The menu is great. Some really original stuff. While the spaghetti and meatballs is a must have, I could do without the fried boccancini. It was small portioned and nothing to brag about.

The spaghetti comes premixed and it's saucy but I love that. They pile on the parm so be sure to request if off if you don't want it. The garlic bread is pure heaven but definitely strong. 

If you're a pasta eater, please try Emmys and you'll never feel the same.
author: Sarah S.

description: No more Buca de pepo, I know some people didn't like that place anyways, but I did! I love pasta, lasagna, spaghetti all of it. So having this place around is a relief for me whenever I have cravings. The meat balls and spaghetti is what I get, and the meat balls are pretty good size. The place is a bit small,and can get filled up pretty quickly, on a weekend, so don't be surprised. Make reservations if anything, and I recommend for a casual date. I don't believe it's too fancy for semi formal, and the food is pretty filling. What you see is what you get, so as I said it's not this super fancy place, lower your expectations. The quality of food is bomb, that's what really makes this place. Enjoy
author: Santiago E.

description:
So I obviously had to come here because this is the only restaurant I've heard of that I share a name with. But regardless of the name, I would've come here because of the amazing pasta being served every night. I read on Yelp that I could split the Emmy's Spaghetti and Meatballs with one other person and be completely satisfied. However, boys are boys, and my boyfriend didn't want to split just one dish so we ordered the Butternut Squash and Italian Sausage Pappardelle in addition the the Spaghetti. Well, the Yelpers were right and we would have been fine splitting the spaghetti.. but I was really happy to taste the pappardelle :) Plus I got to have leftovers for lunch the next day! 

Their service is very good as well. You can tell that servers love working at Emmy's and have been around for a while. To me, you can always tell a good restaurant by how their servers feel about the place. Our server gave us excellent recommendations, though I don't know that you can go wrong with anything that you order. 

Definitely a solid place in the Mission to grab some delicious pasta. I'll be back!
author: Emmy Q.

description: love the new, bigger location. Comfort-food American-style pastas. I'm not usually a fan of American versions of anything, but Emmy's does it so well. Caesar salad with anchovies and spaghetti & meatballs are must tries...even for people who normally would never order either of those items. Portions are generous, and make great leftovers, and for San Francisco, the prices are excellent.
author: Sandy J.

description: This place is super fun environment loud boisterous upbeat. Foods pretty good roasted cauliflower and mozzarella balls are highly recommended They are super tasty. Another menu item is the vitality salad pretty good salad going spaghetti and meatballs were okay bring your apetite or your taking  a doggie bag home.
author: Tina Jo O.

description:
While I would like to rate Emmy's higher, the service was so awful that I simply cannot. It's a shame too because the food we were served was good. But the food that never came, the wine I wasn't able to order (I couldn't go uncork it for myself!) and the dessert we were never able to order will forever remain a mystery... Luckily we went to Mitchell's ice cream around the corner. They were packed and still offered 5 star service. Unlike our server, Kaitlin, who clearly doesn't understand what it means to be a waitress... She was simply AWFUL.

Caesar Salad
Rasta Pasta
Prawn Habanero Risotto 
Orecchiette Pasta with asiago cream sauce with pancetta and asparagus

The meatballs, chocolate truffle cake and whatever yummy wine = all of unknown quality and taste since our waitress who was: 

NOT friendly
NOT interested in our table (she was too busy talking to what appeared to be the female manager while she ate for the entire duration of our visit).

She never once asked if everything was okay.
She never once asked us if we wanted anything (I mean ANYTHING) after we placed our order. (Hence my inability to order wine or dessert or to even learn WTF my meatball order was!)

Lack of service and being IGNORED the entire time. What a lousy experience. I couldn't get anything from her whether it was fresh ground pepper for my Orecchiette, more water or the stuff they sell. Didn't matter!

NEVER AGAIN after this experience.
author: Karen G.

description: Yummy food, great service, kid friendly atmosphere. Great for those lazy nights! Always big portions and tasty homemade lemonade.
author: Hannah M.

description:
Last time I've been to Emmy's was probably around 2011 but decided to give them another go as take out this time. We decided on the spaghetti with meatballs and one order was certainly enough for two. As we remember it it arrived largely portioned, with hot, massive meatballs and a tangy sauce. S & MB isn't a particularly inspiring dish but it did its job. Should have gone for the garlic bread but decided against it since we were indulging in carbs with the spaghetti alone. 

There are other pasta dishes that look tantalizing (Rasta Pasta!). I guess Emmy's back on the rotation!
author: Esther A.

description: I absolutely love this place! The spaghetti and meatballs are to die for! Make reservations​!
author: David R.

description: Yummy! The food was great! The service was a little gruff and snarky.
author: JaDawn W.

description:
I used to live 3 doors up from Emmy's when it was on Virginia Ave. and loved it. The new location is great - much bigger and more comfortable. The spaghetti and meatballs was just as delicious as it was way back then! 

We came on a Saturday with a large group. Reservation process was easy and accommodating. Our table was ready right on time and everything ran smoothly.  Food, drinks, and staff were all around great! 

Thanks Emmy for a fun Saturday night with friends!
author: Paola N.

description: AMAZING food and service. Kelli was our server and had the best recommendations and reminded me of my leftovers that I almost forgot! We had the mussels as an app (my first time and super yummy) and I had the Zoodle dish as I need dairy free. If I wasn't moving I would definitely be back. All the love for Emmys!
author: Lauren S.

description:
Really nice laid back place. The waitresses are really friendly and nice. We had the spaghetti with meatballs and it was very good. Hot too.

They don't serve iced tea, it would be nice if they would. We don't drink alcohol, but otherwise everything else was very nice.
author: D L.

description: Small local joint best to make reservations. Different decor but great service and good spaghetti.
author: Cindy S.

description:
Food was pretty good. Nothing special. Good portion sizes though.

Service was kinda bad and waitress was unattentive but they seemed understaffed.
author: Monisha R.

description:
As soon as you walk in you know you'll be back again! 
Wait staff is super helpful, the ambience is eclectic and cute, and the Foooooood- omg!

We ordered the cauliflower mozzarella fried cheese, the spaghetti and meatballs ( A MUST) and the peanut butter bar dessert. (Super decadent, great for PB lovers, but you'll need an army to finish) 

Can't wait to go back! 5 star fo' sho!
author: Christina R.

description:
Ok Emmys, I'm quite upset that I am writing this review. Let me start with the fact that as soon as I walked in I could feel unwelcoming vibes. I tried my best to ignore them. As an out of town "tourist" I heard raving reviews about their spaghetti and meatballs. My brother and I were so excited to finally get a taste of what we had heard so many good things about. We sit down and it took forever to even be greeted/get water. We had to wave down one of the managers to give us some water. I'm honestly all about second chances, so I let that part slide. 
We then got a plate of "bread" which I noticed was just pieces of hard stale bread gathered from a huge pile of bread stacked together in this plastic bin- Yuck! Cold and hard.
Next- out spaghetti was mediocre at best. The meatballs tasted good, but the pasta was almost bare
Lacking sauce. So we ate what tasted plain noodles with okay meatballs. Cool.
This part really set me over the edge- as a tourist I am
Wanting to feel hospitality. No no no, not here. We were RUSHED. As soon as they could tell we were finishing our pasta they came around for the check. I was still finishing my wine and my brother his beer. They asked us- while we were still relaxing and enjoying our drink- if we could GET UP from our table and drink our drinks in the back corner of the restaurant so other guests could sit down I've never been so baffled. I get up to go look at where she wanted us to move to and man it makes me more upset. The tables looked like little kiddie tables with sprite cans and soda stains all over the floor and tables by a pinball machine! So they wanted us to move from our nice table to a sticky uncleared corner in the back so they could seat other guests, although we weren't done with our drinks. I'm still shook. I will never go back here or recommend this place to anyone in SF. Thank you and farewell.
author: Daniella V.

description:
Do yourself a favor and have the spaghetti and meatballs. If you haven't eaten all day and are really hungry then you may be able to finish the whole plate yourself, otherwise its large enough to feed two people.
The garlic cheese bread is super garlicky so make sure everyone at your table has some!
The cauliflower mozzarella cheese balls are breaded and deep fried. They are perfection, crispy on the outside and gooey and hot on the inside. Amidst all this carb orgy we had the goddess salad, cause you know, watching our weight,  its filled with fresh apple slices, quinoa, leafy greens and goat cheese. Again its large enough to share.
I had the house red served in a generous carafe, its a perfectly acceptable red wine, reminiscent of what you'd get at nona's house.
We finished up with the peanut butter bar topped with vanilla ice cream and a nice French press coffee, then we headed to the back to take our picture in an old-timey photo booth ( 3 pictures for 5 dollars) where there is a pac man console and a pinball machine to play if you're waiting for your table.
I should add, the servers were super. It was an all female shift, and they hustle! Friendly, efficient and hard working. Our courses were perfectly timed so we didn't feel rushed at any time despite the line waiting for a table.           
 We are heading back again to explore the menu, but definitely for the spaghetti.
author: Catherine P.

description:
Good food and good service. 
Very noisy. If the music was lowered you could enjoy it while you held a conversation. We will be back for the food despite the extreme sound assault.
author: Marla A.

description:
- Amazing zoodles for which I subbed 2 meatballs for the prawns.
- Delicious and expansive drink list.
- Staff was nice enough.
- Clean bathrooms.
- Cool vibe.
author: Mari E.

description: Good food. Fast and pleasant service. A little crazy getting in the door, even with a reservation. But a great time overall!!!
author: C F.

description:
AMBIANCE Feels like dive bar meets mama mia.  A collection of aprons are strung across the walls.  Tables lined with glittery plastic covers.  Lights are low.  Candles are lit.  Eccletic sprinkled all over.

FOOD Been a fan of Emmy's Spaghetti Shack since her days on Virginia Avenue.  Consistently delicious Italian food.  Menu is filled with yummy gems.  Classic spaghetti and meatballs, perfectly sweet tomato sauce and big balls of meat to compliment.  Recently tried the orecchiette with pancetta and asparagus in Asiago cream sauce - what a mouthful of rich creamy goodness.  Not too salty.  I enjoyed the crunch and texture of the asparagus and bread crumps on top.

CUSTOMER SERVICE  Always friendly.  I wonder which one is Emmy.

PARKING Scarce.  Drive around the block a few times.  Parking at the Bank of America lot for $12/evening rate (wah!).

OVERALL Emmy's Spaghetti Shack is a family favorite for comfort italian food surrounded by a fun atmosphere and hipsters.

TIPS Check out the fun photobooth in the back room, alongside a pinball machine.  Reservations available via Yelp, another plus!
author: Elsie S.

description:
Some days I have a craving that can only be satisfied by one thing in the entire world.  You might question how different or amazing a caesar salad can be, but Emmy's stands alone.  It is that good.  So good that I'm willing to dish out $17 for my favorite takeout, despite the sometimes arrogant, sometimes sloppy, sometimes indifferent, sometimes truly atrocious service.  

The front of house* interview for new hires, must go something like this:

1) Is your temperament best suited for ANY job besides customer service?
2) Do you hate kind people?
3) Do give zero f*cks?

"Yes, to all three? You're hired".  

*Back of house seems genuinely more suited for customer service and since they're the ones making the delicious salad, any stars salvaged are thanks to them.  

The spaghetti and meatballs is fine, I'd rate it slightly above average.  
The shack itself is cute, has a very authentic, ambiance-rich feel... (but be warned, the dishes/restroom/tables sometimes leave something to be desired when it comes hygiene).
author: Alexia J.

description:
This place is substantially better than you think it's going to be. I was hesitant when a friend suggested we go to this place for a bite. But after the meal, I can confidently say it was delicious and I will definitely be back. The portions are substantial.

We put our names in for a 30 min wait and headed to the bar next door for a beer. 

We got the Green Goddess salad to start. Nice huge portion for two people. My friend got the spaghetti w/ meatballs - which was so big he couldn't finish it, and we are eaters. I got the pappardelle with pork ragu with shaved green onions, which was so good I basically locked the plate clean. All of that, along with $3 tecates has me very full and very happy. A 100% repeat. 

Some notes: the music was 90s hip hop, and the restaurant is quite loud. So don't plan on coming here for a pasta romantica.
author: Alex L.

description: Heard about this place on an SF blog and it didn't disappoint! Unfortunately we missed our reservation so we had to wait, but only 20 minutes, which I think is really reasonable considering the tales of out-of-the-door lines, and the place was busy! We started with a cesar salad to share, garlic bread, and I had a small of the soup of the night, which was carrot. 3 out of 4 of us thought the salad was great, 1 thought it was dry...The garlic bread was garlic-y! No garlic powder crap used on this stuff, it was cheesy and great! My soup was really bland, I could tell it was fresh, but it definitely needed some flavor. My mom and I got the spaghetti and meatballs, my sister got the orecchiette, and my dad got the fettuccine. Everyone really enjoyed their meals, but I think the spaghetti was the crowd favorite!
author: Courtney B.

description:
Beware! Very dirty place! We read the reviews and  decided to stop by. We started by ordering water and the waitress gave us a poor attitude and threw a dirty water glass with no ice on the table spilling part of it.  The bread was old and cold.  The menu was
Very hard to read.  Stopped at the restroom to wash my hands, very dirty.   Where is the health board??? Attitude is every thing. So dark most
People don't realize how dirty this place is.
author: Jonathon I.

description: Best spaghetti and meatballs in town! I recommend reserving a booth ahead of time to chill and have a few drinks. Very cozy vibe in the back.
author: Brandon L.

description:
Super cool concept. Outside does not look like what you would expect in the inside. One of the best Italian dishes I've ever had. I'd say it's better than other overpriced high end Italian restaurants in SF. They serve huge portions and price is very reasonable. They have BOMB garlic cheese bread, and bread in general. Their pastas are not heavy, but taste amazing. Usually with Italian food, it gets too heavy and you feel shitty afterwards, but it wasn't the case with this place. This would be an amazing date night place, they have a cute photo booth in the back! 

If ever I crave Italian, this would be my #1 go to spot :)
author: Tracey K.

description:
I'm still lamenting the departure of El Zocalo, my favorite bargain spot for pupusas on steroids with fresh curtido and seven-days-a-week menudo with a whole lotta bone cartilage. I'm a man of simple, south-of-the-border tastes, an irony I know, as I am a Far Easterner. But they decided to close, and I was left with nothing. NOTHING. Then I find out Emmy's took over the space? EMMY'S? Do you mean that thrift-shop corner spot up the street with the movable naugahyde booths and the Chef Boyardee spaghetti? I'm giving up my my menudo for that? And indeed I did as I decided to give the new Emmy's a try this past week, and what can I say? Well, it was like the big reveal at the end of an episode of "Trading Spaces" where the wife sobbed uncontrollably at how her bedroom walls were covered with chicken feathers. Decorator ego run amok.

I didn't sob when I walked into Emmy's, but let's say I felt a strong case of Church Lady small-mouth when I saw the crowded tables, the bustling kitchen and the full bar with the music blaring from the speakers. Funky, vintage vibe tailor-made for the millennial mindset. I was about to turn around when the preoccupied hostess asked me if I was going to eat or drink. Gee, I didn't think it was a choice at a restaurant. I thought you could do both, but feeling like Sophie with her two crying children in front of the Nazi, I blurted out "Eat...yes, eat". She motioned me to sit at the bar in between alcohol-infused hipsters with their elbows firmly planted on the counter. I was given their graffiti-styled menu where I had to make out the words in the near-dark (photo: http://bit.ly/1wAVjeb). Pretty soon I was having a Helen Keller moment until I recognized the word Caesar. OK then, I shall start with the $10 Shack Caesar.

It was pretty good if too overly sauced with their house-made creamy dressing (photo: http://bit.ly/1E5EuzT). I like how they left the hearts intact the way I prefer a Caesar, but I'm bummed I couldn't see I could have had anchovies for a dollar extra since I couldn't read that footnote in the shadows of the hard liquor bottles. For my entree, I didn't return to their locally renowned meatballs but instead went healthy with the $16 Zoodles Rasta Pasta. This, I liked a lot, because the pasta was replaced with zucchini and other squash cut into a noodle-like consistency and then covered with pieces of roasted chicken and a light marinara sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1K1HVej). With a little grated Parmesan, it was a nice light alternative to their pasta. It actually made me want to get one of those Vegetti zucchini spiral cutters to make my own. I would have enjoyed it if there weren't people behind me talking loud as they sipped their Chablis. Now if they started serving pupusas, maybe I wouldn't have minded as much.

FOOD - 3.5 stars...overdressed Caesar compensated by zoodles well turned...I'd come back just for that if only...
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...crowded especially unbearable at the bar and quite loud from all the patrons chattering away
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...no complaints about the serviceable bartender whom I has to communicate in sign language...like I said, Helen Keller moment
TOTAL - 3 stars...Emmy and her loud, hipster-heavy vibe makes me cry nostalgically for El Zocalo.
author: Ed U.

description: I ordered their spagetti With meatballs via one of those food delivery services. I have actually been meaning to try Emmy's for a long time. Anyways their spagetti and meatballs is amazing, the portions are pretty big too and I had enough left over for lunch the next day! It tasted even better as a left over :) the meat balls were seasoned well and the sauce was good. Very simple and delicious !
author: Janet Z.

description:
I'm a huge spaghetti and meatballs junkie and this place really satisfied my cravings. This place uses excellent ingredients that radiate throughout the recipes.

Food: The pasta is fresh and balances well with the sauce. The meatballs are blended nicely and well seasoned. Next time, I'm ordering an extra! Best of all the spaghetti and meatballs is only around $11. The garlic bread is also noteworthy. A nice balance of buttery, cheesy and good 'ol deliciousness.

Experience: I usually try to get there 5 minutes before they open but I've also been there when the waits been about an hour. The service isn't spectacular but they are friendly enough. I could tell try to get you in and out but I did not feel rushed through my meal by any means.

Location: I imagine parking can be a problem since the location boarders a residential area. I didn't have any trouble but I could have very well gotten lucky.

This is more of a 3.5 star place to me but I'm rounding up because their food is just as good to-go.
author: Chris W.

description:
I love Emmy's. It was one of the first places I dined at when moving to SF and it remains one of my faves.

I dined here on a very quiet Saturday night. My two friends and I easily found seats at the bar and everyone was very relaxed - perfect. This is not typical Emmy's and that made me very happy (I don't care for loud crowded places). Most come here and rave about the pasta and meatballs and indeed the meatballs are delicious. However I am all about their Ceviche. 

5 Stars - food. The ceviche is delicious. They use lots of cilatro and some spice resulting in a flavorful but not overly spicy dish. I had their meatballs on the side. Lots of seasoning, not over cooked and the marinara was delicious.

5 stars - cocktails. Their Pear Mule is delicious. Its not sweet and I'm pretty sure they use real pear puree. Loved it.

5 stars - ambiance and staff. I love the art and writing on the wall and the staff is super friendly. They were also playing 90s R&B and hip-hop and this by itself made me happy. 'No Diggity

I'm not in the area usually but for Emmy's, I'd make a special trip.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Good and solid Italian! The decor is also unique but entertaining. Def worth trying. 

Spaghetti and meatballs are a must try! Also the steak.
author: Nelson S.

description:
What a cute place! Spaghetti may not sound like much but it's delicious and I get weird cravings for it sometimes.

We split a bottle of wine, the cesar salad, spaghetti and meatballs, and dessert. It was a simple, yet fantastic meal. Their house bread was pretty legit too. I'd definitely go here again.
author: Ringo M.

description:
Oh Emmy, if your service was just a wee bit better this would have been five stars! Great vibe, delicious food, a photo booth in the back that we took advantage of, but we had the following misses:

1. I was done with my beer before the entrees were served and I was never asked if I wanted another. I would have ordered another beer but once I was halfway through my meal it was too late (I was never asked anyway so it didn't matter).

2. Our waiter never stopped by to ask how the food was. A different waitress served our food and after that everyone was MIA until it came time to clean the plates away and give us our check. The restaurant was no more than 2/3 full so it's not like it was busy.

On a semi-positive note, they forgot to serve our salad and when I mentioned this to the waitress who was giving us our main entrees she took them away, served our salad about 5mins later, and I'm pretty sure they fired up completely new entrees for us. That was nice.

Would I go back? Sure, and I still gave 20% as overall we enjoyed ourselves, but it's too bad that for whatever reason we received lackluster service which meant that they didn't get revenue from another beer and we decided not to stick around for dessert.
author: Mitch K.

description: Local landmark with lots of customers, friendly staff, and tasty comfort food.  So popular that we had to wait almost 1/2 hour after our reserved time to be seated.  We had 2 appetizers and split a salad and a spaghetti w/ meatballs. Satisfying meal with superior service once we were seated.
author: Linda H.

description: Fun, quirky environment with excellent food and wine. I had spaghetti and meatballs (awesome!) and my friend had the "zoodles" (zucchini noodles) - which she loved. We also had a ceviche appetizer, which was also terrific. Great, fun and attentive server to boot. If you're looking for a high end fru fru Italian place -- this ain't it. But if you want great food in fun environs and at reasonable prices -- use Yelp to make a reservation!!
author: Alan E.

description: I am a first timer here and I loved it... it met all of my expectations. I've heard good things about this place and I see why. Staff was nice, dinner was good, and my company loved the video games... LOL I walked away with pictures from the photo booth... It was a good night!
author: Kira B.

description:
This place is legit!  Delicious, fun and chill.  It's nice to get down-home Italian food in SF, without being stuffy and pretentious.  

We ordered Spaghetti & Meatballs, Marina Spaghetti, and the Prawn Habanero Risotto. Everyone loved what they chose.

They also have a nice selection of sparking wine.
author: Maryn R.

description:
Duh, get the meatballz.
But that steak, well it's the tops.
Booths are the right vibe.
author: Nish N.

description:
Took the family (wife, 2 kids) to Emmy's for the first time last weekend.

Summary: spoiled by poor pricing. Won't be going again.

The decor is cool - hipster spagetti shop but kid friendly. A little dark, but kids of crayons and there is a photo booth and pinball to keep them busy for a while.

Ordered kids spag/meat ball to the 2xunder 4 kids to share, the 10$ mozerella balls apt and a couple of mains. Food was honest and tasty, but we were bummed out by a few things:

- mozzarella balls for $10 turned up and they were "5 balls, the width of a quarter" with a splash of ranch and red sauce on the side. Less than 20 seconds and they had gone - it was literally a 'pop in the mouth and its gone' taster. We assumed the 10$ was a misread and that this was 5$, although even that would have been a little rough for what was 50c of food in a fryer. 

- kids meal was larger than both our mains! even though they shared and mum and dad ate a lot, we had a good take home container. I don't know many kids that could eat that much - teenagers however...!

- waitress when asked about the mozz ball pricing said "email emmy" and left us to it. 

Its not 1 star, but neither will we be back soon.
author: Nick L.

description:
I love the spaghetti and meatballs, the quirky decor, the rearing horse motifs, and the hard working servers with flair. 

Good wine list, beer list, and other snackies. 

Wear your stretchy pants, you're going to overeat on delicious comfort food.
author: Tasha D.

description:
This place is a joke. So disappointing and the regret of choosing this place as out first meal in SF! 

Nothing special at all about the Spaghetti or the Orecchiette (bland). 

Thumbs up on the garlic bread though. You cant go wrong there, I guess.
author: Linda N.

description:
We called in around 7:40pm for a table of 2 on a Friday night and was told there would be about an hour wait. We arrived around 8:30pm, and were seated by 8:45pm, so that was awesome.

We were pretty hungry from waiting to eat, so we thought we could each finish a pasta dish. We ordered the cheesy garlic bread, spaghetti and meatballs, and the clam and mussel linguine. We were wrong! The portions are larger and much more filling than they look and we had plenty of leftovers to take home. Both pasta dishes were good, but I liked the spaghetti and meatballs a little more. The cheesy garlic bread was deliciously cheesy and garlic-y; it almost tasted like the clam and garlic pizza from Golden Boy Pizza, just sans clams. 

The service was good and the atmosphere of the restaurant was divey and cozy.
author: Michelle W.

description:
PLEASE BEWARE! FRAUDULENTLY ALTERED MY CREDIT CARD TIP

I have went to this place in the past when they were located across from Safeway. I was excited about checking out their new location. The food is good but when I checked my credit card 3 weeks later I found that our waitress Kelli had altered her tip. I am very disappointed and never expected this kind of restaurant to be fraudulently altering tips. Customers please beware and check your accounts online to see if this has happened to you too. Not sure if it's just Kelli or other waiting staff as well. It really sucks because I liked the place and now I won't be going back. 

I gave this place one star based solely on my experience and not being able to trust this restaurant when paying with my card.
author: Johanna P.

description:
Unique spot! This place serves delicious pasta dishes in a raucous bar-like setting. Their menus are handwritten and delightfully hard to read. We ordered an Italian Chianti that was decent for $10/glass. My husband got the classic spaghetti and meatballs which was delicious. I ordered the fall pappardelle which was butternut squash and Italian sausage in a creamy-esque sauce. It was good although cream sauces are so rich it's hard to eat more than a few bites. 

All in all I thought this place was really fun, and the only reason I gave 4-stars instead of 5 is because you end up paying $17 or so for a plate of spaghetti. Which isn't necessarily ridiculous by San Francisco standards, but still seems a little silly!
author: Lindsey B.

description: This restaurant is always busy.  They have very simple menu but the food is great food, not so great service though. I feel like they just want you to eat fast so they can turn the table over to another group of customers. One Star dropped for the long wait and no takeout for certain days.
author: Eldam S.

description: Yummmmm food has lots a flavor and the portions are good enough to share !!! Great food and great music, I defiantly will come back.
author: Erika M.

description: Pretty nice chill spot. Hippie rock decor. Very difficult to read hand-written menu. My friend had the rasta pasta, I got the papardelle. His was al dente and a little spicy, in a good way. My pasta was pretty squishy and the pork ragu was fattier and saltier than I prefer, but probably good if you like that. My raspberry mojito was strong. This place might be worth more stars, but I'd have to order something different next time. Maybe long floppy noodles are too much chewing if al dente?
author: Kris F.

description:
I absolutly love this place every time we come here are so very pleased with the service and the food.  On our prior visit we sat at the bar and the bartender was great he made some suggestions for dinner that we had been considering but always looked past (zoodles) Amazing so full of flavor just the right combination of acid to compliment the dish. On our last visit which was last night April 27, 2016 of course the drinks were great and the food amazing again, my only issue is with the booths on the right side wall as you are walking to the back.  
I hope the owner or managers takes note of this. 

On several occasion we were placed in a booth on the right side wall as you walk to the back, having been in the restaurant business for over 30 years I understand about filling the seats and making sure you have the seating to accommodate as many people as you can the only problem with that is the booths on the side of the restaurant I have mentions are soooooooooo small.  Last night the server was so nice that once a booth came open on the opposite wall (kitchen side) she moved us.  Please look at making these booths more accommodating for everyone of any size.  I am not a small person but i am also not a very large person giving people room to eat drink and enjoy themselves is and should be the priority of any establishment and dont get me wrong we have enjoyed your establishment for 8 years now and will keep coming back, but wont take a booth on the rights side wall.   

I really hope that management will fix the situation of the booths on the right side wall. 

Thanks so much for such fabulous restaurant in the mission
author: B H.

description:
they treat couriers like trash. always get ignored here. if u dont want delivery get off caviar. if ur a hipster douchebag im sure your experience is different.
i'm guessing the bartender is overworked. that or they just hire stuck b.tches
author: Alix C.

description:
I was asked to wait even though several tables was empty. This was okay because I was under the impression that they might have been reserved. Apparently not, I was given the same table after 15 minutes. Servers were simply busy chit chatting :(

Food was strictly okay. Nothing to rave about. 

Service was horrible. I had ordered a vegetarian pasta. They served me the sausage version of this dish. When I pointed out the discrepancy, the server simply took the dish. After 5 mins or so, while passing by, she asked us to wait and mentioned that vegetarian version would be out in 10 minutes.

No apology for her mistake or even any mention of it.

There are several better options in San Francisco.

Avoid this place. You've been warned.
author: Sam M.

description:
The new location looks and feels like the old place, however, it did have a lot more seating. I'm not sure why they can't get rid of the bathroom smell though, maybe it's that vibe they want to set off? Who knows...After being in the restaurant for 15 minutes, I think your nose will immune to the restroom smell and focus on ordering the food. The spagetti and meatball haven't changed, it's still the same quality as the old restaurant (read older reviews). I ordered the steak and I think it wasn't bad, the steak was cooked to the right medium rare that I had asked for; however, the sides of veggie was over salted. The mash potato was creamy and good. But because the sides were overly salty, I had to take a bite of EVERYTHING in order to balance out the seasoning.

When in doubt, it's better cook underseasoned because you can add, but not take out salt. Either you try to make it perfect or go under, oh wells. This place has kept up with the quality as before. Good job...
author: Elaine Y.

description:
First, let me start by saying that several years ago we had our first date at Emmy's and now we're engaged to be married. 

In conclusion, Emmy's is a magical place. To be fair, I may be speaking with a slight nostalgic bias, but honestly, the food and casual atmosphere can not be beat. We've been going to Emmy's for years and despite a move from their initial location, the food has remained delicious and unchanged and the vibe is relatively the same.

Nowhere else in the city can you get such a delicious and generous portion of spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs are HUGE, tender and flavorful - just like grandma used to make.

Not to mention the Shack Girls & Guys are always friendly and ready to offer honest recommendations (the Rasta Pasta, Shack Caesar, & Beet Salad are all bomb). That is if you suffer an aneurysm and decide to not order the s'ghetti and balls.

P.S. Save room for the donut dessert.
author: Stephanie V.

description: First time here and it did not disappoint. Loved every dish -- stand outs were the pulled pork pappardelle and the Mayan habanero risotto. The drinks were great too, not shy on the pours. It is hard, but leave room for dessert the chocolate truffle cake is a must.
author: Gaby M.

description:
We had a reservation so we were seated right away (good thing: on the way out  there was a line) at 5:30 Friday evening. 

Menus are whimsical.  Not a huge menu but good choices. 

The ambiance is lively,  dive bar like,  with pinball room in the back, where the kids rushed to play.

The spaghetti and meatballs bowl was huge.  The prawn jabinero risotto was thick,  spicy with a lemony zing.  Way spicy but good.  Hubble had the zucchini noodles which he really liked. 

We tried the spicy margaritas which was so spicy I couldn't drink it.   Especially after eating spicy risotto.  

We finished with the homemade cinnamon donut covered with Mitchell's vanilla ice cream and caramel and also the peanut butter bar and the chocolate mousse type creation: all three of them were fantastic so the three of us just shared.

Meal total w drinks, dessert. $160

Service was friendly, spot on.

A great place to hang out before the theatre.
author: David F.

description:
I LOVE this place. First visit was with my son before the TSFM. I had the Rasta Pasta and it was so good I couldn't stop thinking about it. I went back solo two days later. 

I don't think I have given 5 stars before but Emmy's made me very happy.
author: Alicia E.

description:
New location = same great food, more seating, good service.

Downer = less ambiance and not nearly as quaint as their old location. Their new photo booth in the back is also kind of annoying. There's an opening on the top that they need to cover as the flash is distracting to diners faced in that direction. 

I'm hoping that in time this new location recreates the feeling their old space had.

love,
me
author: Darin E.

description:
I've been here several times and I'm finally writing down my opinion.  I came here recently with my girlfriend for dinner.  There was a line, but I made same day reservations through their online system.  It was very easy process and we didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes before getting seated.  That's a plus for their system.

We ordered the prawn ceviche and a spaghetti with meatballs to share.  Be advised, the portions are large.  The ceviche was very good, a perfect balance of heat and tanginess.  But taste buds were salivating as a I ate.  Then came the spaghetti with meatballs next, which is hard not to like.  On the dish was three giant meatballs surrounding the pasta with marinara sauce.  Not overly sauced, delicious and warming.  Thanks for this great dinner.  I will return.
author: Loi L.

description: If you're going to the spaghetti shack, I guess you better get the spaghetti. What we ordered -- the beet salad and orecchiette -- was decent but nothing to match the enthusiasm of other reviews. This is a loud, somewhat chaotic place that reminds me of little places I used to go in my 20s to drink too much and talk too loudly. For a couple of gals in their 40s wanting a nice meal before a show in the mission, this didn't quite fit the bill. But it was fairly cheap and filled us up. Mission accomplished!
author: Angelique L.

description:
Sangria: good
Caesar salad: good
Special appetizer (portobello w/ pesto, topped with arugula): good
Spaghetti and meatballs: good
Donut dessert: good, albeit overpriced

Sitting under the fan: not too good.  Man, I was cold, and my food almost immediately cooled down.

I'm sure I will be back, but I'll chose to sit NOT under the extra manic fan.
author: Patty W.

description: Emmy's is outstanding, the kind of place when you hear that your friends ate there without you, you're Seriously Bummed. Like, the kind of place you go to on your birthday good. (Which I did earlier this year, and ran into friends! They let us push tables together and it became the best party ever!) Oh and one more time, Emmy's is so good that I have just flat given up on making spaghetti at home any more. Yeah, it's that good. And I'm only writing this now because they don't open for 30 min but you know I am headed there as soon as they do open. Because, EMMY'S IS SO GOOD!!!
author: Carrie S.

description:
This place is great! The service is usually prompt and attentive. The food is consistently good. I usually get the spaghetti with meatballs. It is great every time. They have a nice drink menu as well. Good place to take kids. 
Just a heads up, parking can be a little challenging on fri-sat nights.
author: Peter R.

description: My favorite Spaghetti restaurant. It's well worth the wait and the drive and parking headache. My heart breaks every time I eat spaghetti at other restaurants because they just can't compare to Emmy's!
author: Rainar W.

description: Went for dinner with my boyfriend luckily just had a 5 minute wait usually I hear it's a lot longer so maybe reserve first ,  he had the the spaghetti and meatballs I had the clam and Spanish sausage linguine, Delicious,  quirky place,  great service ( I wish I could remember our waitress name she was so good) ,  great cocktails (good prices 8$).  Very affordable I wish I could have stayed longer for drinks after but we didn't want to take up a table in a busy place!  Highly recommended for a good meal which is very affordable and well priced!!  I will be back!
author: Nadia H.

description: Great pasta and the customer service was great .. First time we ate at this place .. Was passing by last Saturday after dinner leaving from another restaurant in the area and noticed the line of ppl .. so we had to try it this week ..we had all the favorites of other people that yelp ..and nothing but good food.  it was great ..had some garlic bread with the Caesar salad - was outstanding ,spaghetti meatball was very good , we love the  lingune with clam. It's so tasty ... Even took leftover home. We were so full with no room for dessert but we have to share one ..the  dark chocolate good. Next time we have to try the fried donut as our waitress said.  Is the best and favorite
author: David L.

description: I came here the other night and realized I hadn't written a review to sing it's praises yet so here it goes. Emmy's has the most cute, eclectic, quirky, and almost 50's style to it where everything decoration in there makes you smile. From the huge whimsical horse mural to the strings of lights lining the walls, the vinyl covered tabletops and the photo booth in the back, this is one fun place, definitely a unique SF spot! I love to come here because not only is the service great, but the atmosphere is so welcoming and laid back- I mean, they serve Mickey's and tall cans of PBR, you cannot go wrong! The food is fantastic to boot. I always want to order another main dish besides the traditional spaghetti and meatballs but never seem to leave my favorite for another. Every app I have had there has been outstanding, the menu changes but if the ceviche is on there when you go you MUST order it. I also highly recommend the sangria. Emmy's is one of my favorite date night spots but sitting at the bar is always a good alternative!
author: Natalia W.

description:
The atmosphere is kitchy in a way that I expect from this part of the California Coast. The staff is attentive and the presentation is top shelf. The portions are gigantic. Our party of three chose to order two plates and share them, family style. We had the (classic) spaghetti and meatballs, with the (waitress recommended) linguini with clams, mussels, and proscuitto. The sauce offered with the seafood dish was buttery and perfect. We sopped it up with the bread. Spaghetti and meatballs were amazing. I've had many meatballs in my time, and these were among the very best. 
A photo booth ($5) and arcade are also available. Bathrooms are clean.  I can't think of a negative thing to say.
author: Darla E.

description: If you like Italian comfort food and a funky atmosphere this place is like wrapping yourself in a warm cozy blanket of nostalgia. Easy going, and great for groups. A treasure in the Mission/Bernal.
author: Melanie M.

description:
First time here since it moved to the next block. I must say its pretty big now and it still has the great ambience. 
I made reservations here on Yelp and they were very persistent and texted me a confirmation. I was running about 20 mins late bc I was stuck in downtown traffic and they were still able to hold a table for me which was wonderful as I was a bit stressed about running late. 
As my friends and I arrived, they seated us fairly quickly and were very nice. We ordered sherbet temples and beer which was great bc they have a great selection of drinks. Our main dish was spaghetti and meatballs and this is a to die for dish you must order. It's a big portion and the meatballs have sort of a meatloaf flavor which makes it amazing. I'm sure this is a great plate if you want to leave with some left overs and you will not regret it.  
We also ordered orecchiette with panchetaa with asparagus in Asiago sauce with yummy bread crumbs on top. This is amazing. The portion is not so big but it is just enough. This is another plate you must try!
Dessert: cinnamon doughnut! It's a home made cinnamon doughnut with caramel sauce on top and strawberries on the side. It was amazing! I would suggest to share this dessert we shared it between 3of us and it hit the spot! 
I must say I will be coming here more often and thank you to the staff for being so kind!
author: Stacy G.

description:
The ambiance - eclectic cool old school - pretty casual - I like!

The food - could use a little more flavor, but good enough to come back.  Ordered the spaghetti with meatballs and the caesar salad.

The service - Ryan really let us down.  We were excited about the yummy free bread and kindly asked him for some.  He said they are most likely out, but that he would ask the kitchen.  He said they had none so we ordered garlic bread (which we didn't love).  On our way out we noticed two boxes of the free bread (in separate places) half full.  I mean seriously......

This is my first complain about service review - but that's bc it directly affected my food intake.  Don't mess with yummy!
author: Ruchi P.

description: This was pretty disappointing. A long time ago, before Emmy's expanded, I used to trek out to the "outer Mission" and happily wait to sit down to a cozy booth and get the usuals with my friends -- Emmy's spaghetti and meatballs and the caesar salad. It'd been over five years, and I was excited to be out in Bernal Heights and realize that Emmy's was a block away -- Yelp! even let me make a quick reservation. Unfortunately the experience was dismal, and my boyfriend was confused why I had talked the place up. The wait was long. Despite having a reservation for 7:30, we were seated at 7:55.
