The food itself also took forever to come out. While I understand they were batch prepping the spaghetti, the caesar salad took over 20 min.  The spaghetti was not good -- too tomatoey, too sour, didn't have enough parsley and parmesan cheese, something was off. The linguine with clams was much worse. Would definitely not come back.
author: Shirley L.

description: It's just okay. The service is friendly enough and the atmosphere is nice. I had the spaghetti and meatballs with side of garlic bread. The sauce was not very flavorful, and the meatballs were unimpressive. Maybe I'll come back and try something else, but if the titular dish is mediocre, it doesn't hold high promise.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
The only thing that keeps me coming back is the food!!!!! FIVE STARS FOR THE FOOD. 

The service here is absolutely horrible, it takes a while to even get greeted at the door. And then once you're actually seated at the table, it takes a while to get drinks/ food over. Any requests... cheese, extra bread, more water.. is usually followed by eye rolls.

Any who, I normally order for pick up because time and time again I'm left pretty disappointed with the service. Tonight I came home super excited to eat my dinner and come to find out there are no meatballs in my spaghetti. Thanks Pablo for charging me for spaghetti and meatballs but man WTF.

Taking the extra time to check if orders are complete is crucial. Especially if you're receiving a nice tip. Just sayin!
author: Romina L.

description: Food was delicious but we had horrible service! We didn't get get basic drink orders until like 15 minutes after we sat down. After we got our food, we were sort of forgot about. No drink refills, waiter didn't offer dessert. When we finally got our check, we asked to split it and the waitress told us to figure out the spilt and write it down because she was too busy.
author: Kyla N.

description: I thought the sphagetti was good. Nothing to blow you away but still tasty. Kind of a zany interior like you'd expect in a tourist area but it's not. Service was okay. They are open fairly late which is good.
author: Will D.

description: Fantastic food and no wait with a reservation (highly recommended). Really enjoyed my Soju paloma too!
author: Christopher H.

description: "OMG!!! OMG!! OMG!!!" is what my coworkers kept saying after trying a little bit of my left over fall parpadelle with butternut squash and Italian hot sausage in creamy mascarpone sauce topped with pepitos. It was so good I felt like I had to share it with others! This should sum up how delicious this dish is! I even licked the sauce out of the to-go container. Other than delicious food Emmy's has great service, a fun/chill atmosphere and a very creative menu. Try this place if you're ever in the Mission/Bernal Heights area!
author: Trina C.

description: The service was just ok, our waitress seemed distracted and wasn't very attentive. However, the food was very good and the cocktails were very unique and fun.
author: Annika L.

description:
I was leaving el rio and my friend and I were hungry after a day of dancing and drinking.  We decided to check out Emmys and we're both impressed with the tasty spaghettini and beef meatballs. We also had a side of garlic bread.  Yummie.  We will definitely go back and try other items in the menu.  

Btw. This is not a fake review.
author: Steve F.

description:
*Disclaimer: Personally, i'm a firm believer that good food and service go hand in hand. With that being said, this review is solely based on the service we received during a recent visit at Emmy's.*

So, went here yesterday for my birthday dinner with some friends.  I wanted something low key, plus I've been craving for their spaghetti since forever.  The friends I was with has never been to Emmy's, obviously I raved about it and got them to go.  My friend and i shared the spaghetti and the other one ordered the risotto.  Half way through our meal, my friend discovered a hair strand in her risotto.  Initial reaction was of shock and then kind of got grossed out.  We called over one of the servers, the one with nice bangs and told her about the situation.  Her response threw us for a loop! She said: "Are you sure it's not one of yours?...Just kidding."  I'm all for humor and all that, but honestly, that was inappropriate. The way she said it too was of pure annoyance.  Appalled by that,  I called over another server, the tall one with impressive cat-eye make up skills, to ask if there's a manager we can speak with. She said something to the effect of "they pitch in and manage all together"...okay..sure. We told her what nice bangs server said and her response just totally jaws-to-the-floored us. "Oh sorry about that, I'm sure she didn't mean it and she said she was kidding.  We can replace it or just take it out of your bill"  We were totally dismissed and told off in such a condescending way!  At this point, we just wanted to get out of there. We didn't finish our meal.  I felt so bad because I've been telling my friends how good Emmy's is only to be ruined by a hair strand and bad service. Another server approached us, the one with gorgeous long blonde hair, to ask how we're doing and we told her what happened.  She apologized for both servers, which she didn't need to do, and we thanked her for being the nice one that at least tried to smooth out the situation. My friend even went as far as to say that her kindness made it better.  After getting our bill, nice bangs went up to our table to apologize, trying to explain that maybe we didn't hear her say that she was kidding..blah..blah..blah.  I heard her say she was kidding, in an annoyed dead pan way, the thing is...the damage has been done.  If she was trying to be funny, then her joke fell flat.  As for tall girl with impressive cat-eye make up skills, I give you props for having your girl's back, but you also made us feel you didn't have ours...your customer and loyal patron.  My review may just be a blip in all your 4-5 star rating, and ours may just be an isolated case...but, Emmy's, you broke my heart...on my birthday to boot.  I'm breaking up with you for a little bit to mend my broken heart.  I wish you the best for now...and I hope we meet again.
author: Gia C.

description: Food is not bad but service subpar. Both waitstaff who served our table were unfriendly. It was hard to get the waitstaff's attention and they weren't very accommodating to requests. And the restaurant was loud!
author: Amy V.

description: Such a fan of this place!  The portions are huge and delicious.  Their Peanut Butter dessert Bar is extremely delicious!
author: Nell R.

description: Great eclectic funky Sf neighborhood gem! Try to sit at the counter or in a booth. It gets to crowed at the front door. Perfect size portions. Consistently good meal w good vibe atmosphere. Zesty Zucchini noodles (Zoodles) are my favorite thing after the Mozzarella cauliflower balls! Photo booth in the back! Great for kids too!
author: C D.

description:
El Zocalo was a great place for cheap, tasty food.  Emmy's Spaghetti Shack, which recently moved into the the space, not so much.  I went there with three friends and upon entering we all noticed that they hadn't really done much of a make-over except put up shabby aprons & shelving.  The rest of it was much the way El Z's had it.  Its hard to think they put much of an effort into the move.

On their website they state "Later on it gets louder filled with all kinds of people out to have quality food and a good time"...So does that mean the food gets better after 8:00 pm?  If so, good, cause what we experienced at 7:00 pm was a really bland, under-seasoned, poorly prepared dinner of Caesar salad, garlic bread and spaghetti & meat balls.  The noodles were overcooked, the bread barely touched by garlic and the salad was a milky mess of blah.  The parsley on the entree had more flavor than anything served.  Other than that, the drink I ordered was good because it had a Bundaberg ginger beer base but my friends complained about the Sangria.  

I was looking forward to this having never gone to the original location, but was really disappointed.  So many of these reviews overrate the place, which I don't understand.  It's overpriced and lacks quality.  Like much of the change happening in the Mission, this place is just another tasteless hipster hangout.
author: Don R.

description: Took my mom who was in town visiting to Emmy's for a fun night out since she hadn't been before. We had a reservation but our table was not ready when we arrived. No big deal- they had a place for us to sit and we waited just a few minutes until we were seated in a booth. After waiting a bit for our waitress she finally came over to take our order. We ordered wine, starters and entrees. In the meantime, the booth near us was seated by a very large party that also included a HUGE dog. The group was too large to fully fit in the booth so one of the guys was seated in a chair at the end of the booth, along with "bear" the massive dog. This dog was so big that it impeded the staff when they were servicing tables. An hour later we found ourselves without our wine or starters or even water. The large party with the dog was already eating. When we were finally able to flag down our waitress she said she would "check" on our order- she had not bothered to return to our table until we waved her over. She did stop to pet the dog and repeatedly touched her own hair which were both incredible turn offs as we waited for her to serve us our food. Our wine finally arrived and starters shortly thereafter- over 1 1/2 hours after being seated. The large party was done and gone by the time our entrees arrived. This experience was not what we had expected. We picked Emmy's because we wanted to be there. I was embarrassed to take my mother to a restaurant with such poor service and questionable hygiene rules that allow wait staff to touch their hair and animals while working. I like the casual fun atmosphere of Emmy's but this was neither. The small discount for our poor service did not make up for the experience and I doubt we would return.
author: michelle w.

description: Have loved Emmy's since moving to SF. It's the place I recommend to anyone who will listen. Food is delicious and the portions are generous although I wish they were  more forthcoming with the free bread. Ambiance is fun and quirky. They're not pretentious though -- they were super friendly to my gf's really old (and old school) parents. Haven't been a fan of the cocktails but I'm more of a beer and wine person anyway.
author: Marloes S.

description: I never have believed the hype. Its ok food. The drinks are good. I always have gone cause friends wanna go, and i always wish i was eating somewhere else. Not a fan.
author: Nat Y.

description:
I always enjoyed Emmy's at the old location - good food, funky decor, and I didn't mind the wait times. We went to the new location last night and they have a great system in place where they text you 5 minutes before your table is ready. We popped out for a drink next door and it worked perfectly. The new space is bigger but still cute...no problem with that. The food was very good. 

My problem was with the music! What happened? They used to have a DJ playing weird and interesting funky music. Last night they were blasting top 10 hits of the 1950's. I felt like I was in a Johnny Rockets. Or at a bad wedding. I'm guessing you have to have some kind of weird permit to have a DJ and maybe they lost it? Regardless, they could still make their own mix of interesting music. 

I really couldn't go back if they were playing that music. I do like 50's music but it was like being in a theme restaurant in a mall. : (
author: M M.

description:
Looks really fun and nice. The menus were delightfully eclectic-boding well. The goddess salad was really good. The waitress was a tad sharp and officious. The main courses--spaghetti and meatballs, and the short ribs were fine. Not outstanding but fine. Polenta too runny. 

But the main reason I'm yelping is the volume of the music. Wow. So far out of the realm of acceptable. We had to shout to one another to be heard.
author: Lisa B.

description: I'm afraid to give it a "too good" rating because more people will come and it'll be more crowded !  However , that aside I must say the meatballs and spaghetti were exceptionally enjoyable.  Prices are quite reasonable and the family atmosphere of kids as young as infants running around in a very loud environment was actually quite fun.  My wife and I reserved a table ( booth) for 8 PM on a Friday nite.  We were seated just before 8 PM and the service was prompt, courteous and friendly to a fault. Unless you have a very large appetite you'll end up taking home enough for another meal.
author: Bruce M.

description:
The place looks awesome and it's definitely kid/baby friendly --in terms of them having a kid menu and high chairs.  But, the staff kind of ignores the fact that you have a baby...or gives the impression of being annoyed that my baby dropped her toy or something!  Most kid-friendly places will at least smile at the baby...or say hi...or look at them..haha....with the number of kids that come there, I was surprised at how cold the staff was about it.   It definitely wasn't the end of the world....but since they do have a ton of kids coming in during the earlier hours, it would be nice to have a warmer feel about it.  

The vibe is great, service was otherwise ok.  As a vegetarian in SF, I was surprised with the limited options.  For the few veg options they do have, the dishes seemed overpriced.  I wish they had some more filling veg options!  We got the zoodles, which was described really well...but lacked flavor....and was crazily priced at $14 for a medium size plate of zucchini!  absurd! 

I would go back for a drink and maybe an app...but would probably not return for a meal...prob better bet for the meatball lovers! :)
author: Nisha K.

description: Ordered the peach caprese salad, shack caesar, spaghetti with meatballs and risotto. All the dishes were great. The meatballs were really moist and had great flavor. I love the down to earth vibe here.
author: Chi N.

description: I love this neighborhood restaurant! They have a great menu with lots or variety, including vegetarian and gluten free options. The food is delicious and the service is always super friendly. There can be a bit of a wait on weekends if you don't come on the early side.
author: Diana G.

description: The restaurant has limited menu but the food is delicious. The restaurant is always busy but it's worth the wait.  Try it and I guarantee you will like it.
author: James L.

description: In the SF area for a long trip and came here for dinner. My friend who is a local highly recommended this spot. This place is amazing. The atmosphere is lovely- from the decor, to the lighting, to the music to the photo booth. It's super cozy and just lovely. Our waitress was great- friendly and accommodating. We ordered everything but the spaghetti. We ordered the prawn risotto, the orechiette, the cheesy garlic bread, a seasonal pear salad, the meatballs, mozzarella cauliflower bites, the sangria and the peanut butter chocolate dessert. It's hard to pick a favorite because literally every plate we ordered was better than the next. I recommend ordering a bunch of plates and sharing with the table so you can try a variety of menu items- there's just too many delicious things to miss out on. The menus change periodically due to seasonal dishes, etc. Also, the menus are hand written and designed, which shows how serious this restaurant takes their business and service. I highly recommend this spot!
author: Alexandria C.

description:
Great food. Great atmosphere!
Always lots of kids and families.
Tried the meatballs, different pastas that are all very well prepared but the spicy risotto is my favorite!
And I loved the art on the walls too!
author: Virginie F.

description: One of the best oldies but goodies in the Bay.  In a new bigger space but the spaghetti and meatballs hasn't changed.  I love it, simple and delicious in a big portion!  One of the best.
author: Alice E.

description: These are the best spaghetti and meatballs I've ever had, aside from the ones from pizza port at Disneyland. I was a lil high before arriving to Emmy's and I had a sangria which was delicious and strong, so I definitely was feeling good before my meal. When I was served my spaghetti and meatballs, I thought the portion was small, but boy were my eyes tricked. It was a huge serving! The meatballs were full of flavor and moist. A lil raw, which is always a good thing. These balls melt in your mouth. I savored every bite and finished only half of it. I took the home the rest and went to sleep, but I had trouble sleeping because all I could think about was my leftover pasta sitting in the fridge. I woke up and ate the last bit of it, which was as delicious as it was at the restaurant.
author: Jenny A.

description:
This place was pretty decent. When we entered the restaurant we had to wait to be seated but we were standing un-greeted for an uncomfortably long time (4-5 minutes) and it wasn't busy at all. 

Overall this place has a shabby-chic vibe with its 80s style theme, it was strange but I liked it because for a moment I felt like I was in the 80s.

I ordered the special, a penne pasta with cream sauce and veggies and chicken. The dish was filling but the zucchini tasted strange. I would go here again for the quirky vibe.
author: Christopher S.

description:
Love this place!

If you're looking for a place to go heavy on the carbs this is the place for you. I'm gonna keep this simple. If you're craving spaghetti and meatballs order it and flirt your way into getting some extra sauce ;) . 

Pretty cozy restaurant and the food is good. What more could you ask for.
author: Kelly W.

description: Everything was amazing ,waitress however was ungrateful for the tip i left. True it was only 5 dollars on a 80 dollar bill. But it was all i had on me and the waitress felt the need to try and hurt my feelings. But i still recommend going. Even though that one girl was ungrateful for the free money i left her
author: Frank L.

description: Such a rip-off. Used to be good. Overpriced, terrible service, sub par food. I don't know why anyone even goes here anymore. With so many other choices in the neighborhood with much better quality and way better prices, go elsewhere, you won't be disappointed. Shame on them.
author: David C.

description:
Emmy's new location is better than ever. Now it's easier to get a reservation and there is over double the seating as compared with their previous location a few blocks away.


The decor of the restaurant keeps the funky and chill vibe of the Mission and Bernal area, where there are so many good restaurants and foodie spots just steps away and Emmy's fits right in. Both of us ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and we were happy to see the dish lived up to the namesake of the restaurant. It comes served with 3 large all beef meatballs that are made fresh every day. The sauce is on the thick side with lots of tomatoes which makes it easy to spread on the meatballs as you break them apart. They go well with the thicker al dente noodles they use for the spaghetti. Portions are big enough to share or make a hearty meal for one. It made me feel like a kid again, twisting the noodles around my fork, and slurping them up over the red and white plastic tablecloths. You can tell when restaurants put a lot of pride and care into their food, and that can explain why people leave raving about this place, because they know how to make a simple dish well. It's a fun place that will keep me coming back as long as they keep maintaining their high food standards with the chilled vibe of a neighborhood mainstay.
author: Mark Y.

description:
Emily Kaplan procures raw materials which include pasta noodles (thick and good), tomato sauce (not too heavy or salty) and some bad ass meatballs (not greasy and just damn tasty) -- to create an unsurpassed nostalgic dining experience aptly called spaghetti and meatballs.

Much respect to Emily and her hands-on creativity and management to create and sustain not yet another "me too" institution catering to today's customer de jour.
author: Susie S.

description:
So delicious - looking forward to returning and trying more of the menu! Here's what we had:

Orzo salad - a nice green way to start the meal. The stonefruit was especially scrumptious, as were the candied walnuts!
Spaghetti and meatballs - I liked, but not as much as other reviewers. Better than what most could make at home, but not especially stand-out to me.
Orecchiette - my favorite. Awesomely creamy, decadent sauce, with pancetta and bread crumbs that gave the entire dish a nice texture. I also love me some asparagus.

Other pros: we went around 6p on a Sunday, and didn't have to wait! I'd recommend this time, if you can swing it, since the place is known to get pretty packed.

The cons: finding parking was nearly impossible, and the lot that's nearby is a bit expensive. Any parking tips = much appreciated!
author: Shendi X.

description:
One of the worst meals I have had in recent memory.  I am having a hard time understanding how this place got 4 stars on Yelp.  
Plus, the noise level is so loud you cannot have a conversation without screaming.
This place sucks big time.
author: D C.

description: THE BEST. PERIOD. Everything I've ever had is top notch. OMG Peanut Butter Bar dessert is one of my favorite desserts ever in life. Spaghetti, salads, apps & garlic bread are soooooooooo so so good!!!
author: E B.

description: Great spagetti.  I like this place a lot.   Hard to park at.   Bernal has a bunch of good places, i should go there more.
author: Michael E.

description:
My boyfriend and I tend to go to the same places all the time. I finally gave in and remembered a friend told me about this place so we decided to try it. The wait was maybe 5 min and it was already pretty packed. After U.S. We're a few larger groups with or maybe without reservations. It's very divey restaurant, from the outside it looks like it wouldn't be good but when you go in it's pretty spacious and inviting. 

I had the linguini with mussels and clams and chorizo, it was great! And my boyfriend had the meatballs and spaghetti. Those meatballs are big! Lol but he said he really enjoyed it and would love to come back. The drinks were good as well, I had the pear mule (like a Moscow mule with pear purée) and it was so refreshing.

The only downside was that it was just a little loud indoors, slightly hard to hold a conversation between us high, but overall I would most definetly go back and try more dishes.
author: Rosie S.

description:
Personally, I'm not a fan of spaghetti in general. However, if there's anyplace where I'm going have spaghetti, it's here. Let's face the facts; when it comes to spaghetti, Emmy's is the place.

The spaghetti is fine. Actually, I've found that the meatball dishes are much more enjoyable -to my pallet- as an alternative to the pasta dishes. Pair with a beer or wine and you've got a wonderful supper.

During peak hours, walk-in times can be long. However, feel free to patronage one of the many local drinking establishments while Emmy will text your iPhone when your table is ready...or make a reservation.
author: Nathan E.

description:
I love this place and I'm not just saying that because it's in my neighborhood. It's worth coming back to again and again. (There's so many options on the menu to choose from!)

Excellent pasta dishes, the Spaghetti with meatballs isn't the "best" in the city but it's effing delicious and that's good enough for me. Plenty of great starter dishes and the servers are super friendly and cool.

The vibe is casual (yet charming) and it's a fun place to take a friend (or date) to hang out and catch up.
author: DJ P.

description: We went here after taking some pictures and meeting new people at a Gap Instameet in Bernal Heights Park. There was a short wait time, so we sat by the bar and ordered drinks first. I had their Spicy Margarita, which didn't have the kick I was expecting, but was still decent. After we were seated, we ordered their Prawn Habanero Risotto, Spaghetti & Meatballs, and Zoodles with Fresh Crab. Wasn't too impressed with the latter two dishes, but the risotto definitely had that amazing spicy kick to it when I bit into the habanero. They also had this nice little photo booth where we took a few silly group pictures.
author: A L.

description:
I always thought WHO in their right mind pays for spaghetti.... well then I came here and it all made sense. Very lowkey and chill environment for a great meal. The bartenders and servers are very nice. 

So the food is amazing.. I am on a mission to try the whole menu. I would of course get the classic Spaghetti and Meatballs with garlic bread and a cesar salad if its your first time.. DONT forget to get some sangria as well..

This is a great place for a good meal and relaxing atmosphere...
author: Lei F.

description: I hadn't been here with my 4 year old son or seen the new location. I loved this place before, but now that I know how family friendly it is when you go early we'll be back. The service was Efficient and friendly. The drink menu is well curated for both beer and wine. The food menu is packed with comfort and fun.
author: Tyler M.

description:
Another single star review for the "service", or lack there of. 
Husband had a spaghetti & meatball craving.  Walked in at 7:45pm, as a large group was leaving. We were greeted promptly and were told we could be seated but they'd have to set up a table.  
She proceeded to set up what can only be referred as a kids table. It was so low it literally slid under the table next to it!
When my husband asked for a booth that was empty in the back he was told no. When I pointed out that I was 5'10" and that table was going to be really uncomfortable we were told "this is all I have for 2". No "I'm sorry, I understand. If you wait a bit..."    Nothing, just a blank stare. 
Out we walked despite parking right out front!
author: Us And J.

description: I didn't really think you could make me PAY for spaghetti and meatballs, but here I will gladly fork over money for this deliciousness. The other pasta dishes are good and the salads make you feel less guilty about the gigantic plate of pasta you eat, but I don't see the point of going here and ordering anything else but the spaghetti.
author: Kamael S.

description:
I'm going to give the new location four stars mostly because even though they moved to a larger location,  everything is about the same. Consistency folks! 

I can barely read the menu and always give up and order the spaghetti and meatballs. They're good and the price is right. 

Come to think of it,  I don't think I've ever ordered anything else here.
author: Victoria W.

description: Went and had spaghetti and meatballs here last night and loved it!! Been wanting to try this place for a while so I'm super glad I went in. They have great customer service, good food and drinks were good as well. If you like a good michelada have one here! It was one of the best I've ever had :) I will def be back soon
author: Kristine C.

description:
Yelp didn't even exist the last time I ate at Emmy's. That's my way of saying it was time to go back. There's a new location, a few blocks down from the original on Mission (closer to Cesar Chavez), so make sure you Yelp the correct location.

There was a bit of a wait for Saturday night, but luckily there's a bar to keep you occupied while you wait (no reservations allowed).
Emmy herself greets you at the door and pretty much does everything: hostess, server, juggler haha.

Classic order: Spaghetti and Meatballs $13.95. a massive serving of spaghetti, perfectly seasoned on top of 3 even bigger meatballs. This is enough for 2 meals, if you're small like me.

Their menu is on the smaller size, with good reason. Only a few entrees, sides and desserts.

Unfortunately the liquor license at their new place is still pending so only beer and wine are served for now. The bartender mixes up some cocktails with wine as a substitute for mezcal in the Spicy Paloma, still quite tasty.

Huge bonus points for the photo booth in the back!
author: Alyssa G.

description: Delicious and cheap! I've had the spaghetti and meatballs as well as the risotto before. Both were wonderful and service is great.
author: Tavia Y.

description: Love this place. My favorite, Caesar salad is super rich and tasty.  I like how they are not cutting it into small pieces.  The Linguine special with seafood is also sooo good. Very fresh.  Always feel satisfied after eating there.
author: James K.

description:
Since YELP won't let an existing business that just happened to move across the street and are doing the exact same thing, keep their reviews. (one of many reasons I will never advertise my business with yelp) 
I thought I'd move my review over to the new page for Yelp! Originally 1/31/10

Love this place!
Love the food!
Love the drinks!
Love everyone that works there!

But to add-
Love the new space! 
We also go here 1-3 nights a week, it's always great! 

Now I will wait for Yelp to flag this as an "unrecommended review"
author: O. S.

description: This place feels like the 90s. Cute non-hipster, non-fancy, non-"third-wave" type spot. Pasta doesn't taste like it is made fresh, which is lame considering it costs about $15 for a plate of spaghetti and meatballs. The food is decent, but you could easily make it at home. Lines are long on the weekends.
author: R. J.

description:
This place is so cute!!
I ordered the Spaghetti and Meatballs and it was delicious!
I just wished there was more variety on the menu, to be honest.

Loved the ambiance though! It had such a chill vibe. 
Also, the lemonade was so good.
author: Putri S.

description: A friend introduced us to Emmy's & I must say it was great! Love the ambiance, great staff, and kid friendly. Having a one year old, I get a little nervous going out to dinner to certain restaurants but Emmy's was great! I would definitely recommend you to try it out if you already haven't!
author: Angelica G.

description: I've been here half a dozen times now, and it is outstanding. I've had the steak and the oricchetti but nothing beats the spaghetti and meatballs. Not even my Italian mama's recipe can beat it - it's that good. Nice salads and wine. Plus the place is in a fun neighborhood, the service and ambiance is great, can get a bit loud but it's just people enjoying themselves, not being obnoxious. I've been asking the last couple times if Emmy was there so I could give her a warm hello but she hasn't been there. That's ok. My highest recommendation without a doubt.
author: Sean F.

description: Excellent service! Love the new spot. Food was great and drinks were on point. Haven't been here in years and glad I had a chance to finally come back to try something new. I had the ceviche which was really good and my date had the fettuccine. The ambiance is really chill with a little old school relaxing hip hop playing. Planning to come back to try the rest of the menu next time!
author: Ronald D.

description: Great neighborhood gem!  Consistently good.  Get the spaghetti, duh!
author: Christian M.

description: Delicious food, sweet vibe, great music, vintage pinball machines and more. Excellent for date night, family night, and groups.
author: Jenna L.

description: Been here twice and cant wait to come back! Most recently, I stopped in to meet someone for a quick bite but had no reservation. Waited about 10-15 minutes and we sat at the bar. I don't even look at the menu because the spaghetti and meatballs have been 100%. This time I had the alcoholic root beer which was perfect with the meal. The bar tender and staff are super awesome!
author: Rafael R.

description: We've been to Emmys before and thought it was a good neighborhood spot. Not sure what changed but food was mediocre at best-particularly for the price.  Got the paparadelle and cod stew. The cod was better but the paparadelle wasn't really worth eating. Would probably stick to spaghetti if we went again.
author: katie r.

description: Underwhelming. We ordered the spaghetti and meatballs because that's really the staple of any pasta place right? The sauce was nothing spectacular and actually tasted like jar stuff like Ragu.. The pasta was just plain boxed dry spaghetti. Boo-urns. Parking is difficult around here. Service was decent though! But we just had take out so can't really weigh in on it.
author: My C.

description:
We love, love, love Emmy's. Yes, we've enjoyed the food over the years, but it's the whole experience: chill and funky atmosphere, great food, lovely people working there. We've been to the new location twice now-- the second time on a Wednesday eve around 7-ish. We like bar eating, and while the place was full of patrons, the bar had several inviting and open seats. Aside from the spaghetti & meatballs, we like to try the specials, and Wednesday night I died and went to foodie heaven: orecchiette with asparagus, pancetta, seasoned bread crumbs in a light cream sauce. (I see a picture of it below!!) Paired with a carafe of house red, the dish was outta this world.
A neighborhood treasure!
author: Kathryn S.

description: Previously, I was a cook at an Italian Restaurant and always had a hard time finding amazing pasta. A friend brought me here, and I ordered the Orecchiette. I was blown away at how perfectly it was executed! Flawless seasoning, ingredients and cook time. I cannot wait until I get to eat here again!!
author: Scott L.

description:
Came here with a couple of friends. Boy or boy, huge and i mean HUGE meatballs here!! The portion was more than I had expected. If you are hungry and in need of an orgasmic meal come here!

They also serve 40's lol... It was a fun experience.
author: Jay B.

description: I had the linguine plus clams mussels and chorizo. There were at least 15 clams and mussels plus tons of chorizo. Pasta was cooked perfect and was HOT. Great service. We had the cheetah table. It's a bit loud but it adds to the experience. Nothing on the menu was over $20. Ceaser salad was legit. Since this place is in the bernal/mission.its a bit hipster but the food is good. A lot easier than going to NB.
author: Paul F.

description: It's all about the meatballs and spaghetti!  OK the desserts are amazing too and the staff are really cool and skilled.  It will be busy during dinner but try sitting at the bar because they will do a great job taking care of you and you are sure to have an amazing meal!
author: Zach T.

description: REally good service. Great food! Simple and wonderful!
author: Ross S.

description: this place is amazing I have been here so much that I have had everything on the menu. I highly recommend this place. also the spicy lemonade is good too.
author: Jay Y.

description:
I really enjoyed Emmy's Spaghetti Shack! 

The setting was perfect. 

Menu simple but delicious and there's a photo booth in the back. 

Good meal and yummy Sangria, Ill be back!
author: Simone M.

description:
Emmy's finally settled in to the new location.
Same great vibe. Same delicious food. Great, spacious new place.

Before we got there, we already decided on spaghetti & meatballs and ceviche. SADLY, I learned that the ceviche dish is summer only. Dammit man. Why can't ceviche be an all-year-long thing?

Regardless, the food tastes just as awesome as it did at the other location.

The only downside is that there was some miscommunication that led to our dishes disappearing to another table. Which led to us waiting twice as long to chow down. At least the waitress told us immediately after she found out.

I'll miss the small "shack" feel of the original location but I'm excited for this larger, new space to do just as well, especially with more seating available.

Cheers Emmy's!
author: Sandy T.

description:
Hip neighborhood, check. Kitchy decor, check. Spaghetti at a spaghetti restaurant, check.
Emmy's Spaghetti is everything that it promises; quirky, fun, and delicious.
We tried the cesar salad, linquine with mussels, clams, and chorizo, and the zoodles with crab. Food was fast, affordable, and tasty, plus there's a photobooth in back!
author: Sven And Krysta G.

description:
Congrats on the new location! I'm a longtime Emmy's fan.... and was excited to see the new place. Our food was wonderful....  the ambiance is lovely.... 

BRAVO, Emmy!
author: linda b.

description: Emmy's is my favorite restaurant.  It's my happy place.  Food, atmosphere, friends, staff, all great.  I like that you can make reservations now.
author: Dave P.

description: Good food & excellent service,  loved the music & atmosphere!  A fun place to eat & great prices!
author: Trish M.

description: Emmy's, how I love thee!! Yummy pasta, friendly staff, cool vibe. I've tried the habanero risotto and their classic spaghetti and meatballs with garlic bread. Both fantastic. They also make a good cocktail that's a twist on a Moscow Mule. Ignore any bunk ass reviews of this joint. Those people have no idea what they're talking about.
author: Caddy M.

description:
LOUD environment, very loud!
Very good salads,
Entries placed in shallow dishes to make portions look bigger,
Everything is WAY overpriced, $14.95 for spaghetti and meatballs...come on, 
Loud hipster hangout,
For what you have to pay the environment should be MUCH nicer.
Better off going to Lupa, LaNibbia, 
Definitely can do better,
Oh yea, no more hard liquor, only overpriced cheap wine and beer.
author: N. T.

description:
If they are bold enough to put it in the name, it's probably going to be their best dish. 

This definitely works for Emmy's. Went in on a Sunday night and had a few dishes, their spaghetti and meatballs was the standout by far. 

THE SHMAGHETTI:

The portions are huge, noodles cooked perfectly and their red sauce is delicious. Not overly seasoned, but distinguished, fresh and with a nice mouth feel. The sauce coats the noodles well. Their meatballs were huge, juicy and wonderful. Had that great home cooked feel to the dish. 

Also had the clam linguini and the cheese stuffed pablanos. Clam linguini was good, but the chorizo they use has a really strong flavor and the shellfish have a hard time standing up to it.  

The poblanos stuffed with bacon and cheese is a dish I would make at 3am if I was stoned and couldn't find anything in my fridge. Not bad, just weird and doesn't belong on a Italian spaghetti house menu.  Stuffed is an overstatement, sort of a "wedge melted on top of" poblano. 


THE SHACK: 

Kitschy, maybe a little too kitschy. The handwritten menus are hard to decipher, there might have been something I wanted to order, but I'm not playing Where's Waldo with my menu, I just want to see it and order it.  Service was pretty good, but when we came in they didn't have a record of my reservation, I had to show them the text messages to prove it. We might not have been seated otherwise.
author: Patrick T.

description:
Let me start off by saying that my nickname is Emmy, so that earned a star right off the bat! I really wanted to like the place (for that reason!) and I was so pleased that it was actually really, really good!! It's casual and family friendly, but still cool... great music playing, photo booth and video games in the back. Nice since we had to wait about 25 minutes for our table (which we loved) - a big huge booth right in the front window :) We ordered:

~roasted brussels sprouts
~beet salad
~caesar salad
~large cheesy garlic bread
~spaghetti with marinara
~spaghetti with meatballs

We were a party of 5 and it was a TON of food! Portions are HUGE, so you can actually share the orders of pasta (even if you have big eaters). The brussels sprouts were so good, beet salad excellent, caesar a little bland in my opinion, garlic bread very garlicky but good!, spaghetti piping hot smothered in the yummiest red sauce ever. I don't eat meat, but the meat eaters really enjoyed the meatballs too. We left soooo full (with lunches for tomorrow), and will definitely be back!! 5 thumbs up for Emmy's!!!
author: emily b.

description:
I have been going to Emmy's for about 4 years now, so obviously I love it and the idea of it; but I am going to have to finally be brave and provide a less than stellar review that's been building up over time.

1. Since the move, Emmy's has definitely lost it's intimate feel.  The nights were often crowded and the wait was often long at the other location, but somehow, that was part of the romance.  Even having El Amigo bar to wait in while we waited to be seated did something for the experience.  Now the experience is drab and instead of having El Amigo as a place to get drinks, the Emmy's bartender didn't even acknowledge me for 20 minutes (not exaggerating!) as I sat at the bar waiting for a friend.  I tried to make eye contact several times, but then I just gave up and started timing her.  Note: only one other person was at the bar--and she came just to pick up her take out order so it wasn't busy AT ALL.

2. Again, the restaurant is not as packed as it used to be, but still waitresses have more than once forgotten items that myself or my friends have ordered.  Additionally, they rarely check in now to see how we are doing and what we need (something, I must note, that started occurring prior to the move as well).

3. The spaghetti:  when I was last there, it was dry and looked like it was scrapped off of someone else's plate.  It just didn't look freshly made which was embarrassing to me as someone who brought a new friend there.  Needless to say she didn't understand what I have been raving about and I started questioning what I've been raving about too.

To bring this long story to an end, I have been to Emmy's several, several times and  I just must really love spaghetti because between the unhappy looking waitresses, often getting seated in the back when other seats were available, forgotten items and other forms of neglect, I'm going to reassess my love for this place.  I think my friends, the uniqueness of a spaghetti joint, and a chunk of fattening food on a big plate makes the atmosphere, however, I'm not sure about the staff, service, and quality anymore.
author: C. H.

description: Hungry for casual spaghetti without fuss - this is your place!  I like to see a restaurant focus on something and do it well, and that is the case here.  We both had the Emmy's classic spaghetti - nothing too fancy, just hearty thick noodles stained red from being tossed in a savory sauce.  The garlic bread was also tasty but be prepared to smell like cloves of garlic the rest of the night.  Ambience was also nice and chill, if you are looking for romantic candlelight and white linens, head to North Beach.  They offer corkage as well as a selection of wines, and beers, and soju/wine cocktails, no other liquor.
author: Brian G.

description: Great place to eat when me and the wife are in town. Came up for Valentines Day and decides to check out the new location. Definitely more seating and less wait time then the old spot. The food and drinks are great, but parking still sucks! No worries, we'll keep coming here because it's worth it!!!
author: Danny L.

description: Loved the brussel sprout appetizer, and the spaghetti was good but nothing spectacular. I felt pretty bad spending $14 on a plate of spaghetti, but my boyfriend is a huge fan of the place and the meatballs were pretty good so it was kinda worth it. I hadn't been to the old location so I can't compare the two.
author: Mio W.

description: Oh my god! Where do I even start. Okay you guys have to try the ceviche here!!! It is delicious. Not to mention the spaghetti with meat balls. Ahhhh! It was my first time going there, I have to say it was super good!!! The garlic bread is so amazing! Please stop by and check them out!
author: Margarita V.

description: I love Emmy and I love her Spaghetti Shack. Yeah, it's super hipster, but that doesn't stop it from being the spot to get some spaghetti and meatballs. The service is great. The atmosphere is fun and cool without being pretentious. Make sure to try the Pear Mule. Nothing is better than the classic, but if you are feeling adventurous, try the risotto with shrimp -- you won't be disappointed. Great date spot or for small groups. Emmy, you have my heart and my stomach.
author: Jake A.

description:
Love the old location. This was my first time to the new place. 
My husband and I went in around 7pm on Sunday night. We were quoted 20 min wait for a table so we grabbed a seat at the bar until our table was ready. My husband ordered a "personal carafe" of wine that came out of a barrel. I don't remember what it was called. The bartender suggested it. It was acceptable. A bit boring and had a faint hint nutmeg or something. I find it a bit odd that they don't carry any Cabernet. I ordered a 40 of Mickeys :-). 
We were seated pretty quickly. We ordered the garlic bread to share. My husband got the spaghetti with meatballs and he was happy with his dish. I got the habanero risotto with rock shrimp. It was out of this world delicious. I'd suggest not eating the actual habanero that garnishes the dish cause it's hot as f@¢&.

The portions are huge. Ordering an appetizer and an entree to share is totally enough food for 2 people.
author: Az A.

description:
Great food and service.

The Mac and Cheese was divine - we had to place an additional order after devouring the first one. We also had the Rock Shrimp Risotto, spaghetti & meatballs, Paparedelle and the Rockin Cod Stew - all delicious!

We came here for my daughter Emi's birthday. I made reservations with Emmy herself on their Facebook page. Loved the cool atmosphere and the photo booth in the back.
author: Arika B.

description: spaghetti and meatballs are great, but don't try to order to go on the weekends.  They outright refuse, even when they just open and even when I doubt at this very moment they have a high volume of orders.  lame.
author: Chris F.

description:
food was ok... could have pretty much made everything at home... we gave the waitress a 12% tip because food was nothing special and no offense, she wasn't anything special. she wasn't overly friendly or talkative, she just did her job. ok. we were about to leave when she approached us saying, "excuse me, is there something wrong with my service?? you only gave me a 12% tip". we replied, "oh well sorry that soup wasn't really that great..." and she responded, "that's not my fault, you guys should have told me" 

sooo not cool. I'm sorry but asking about a tip? you don't ask why you got a tip like that. a tip is optional and we have the option to not tip at all. I understand that tipping is some peoples main source of income but when we leave out 8% you do not complain. :((((
author: Andi B.

description: Food was great, serivce sucked. I mean it REALLY sucked. Our waitress (short with brunette hair,bangs and tattoos) was horrbile and all the other waitresses were trying to pick up her slack. The food is the only thing this place has going for itself.
author: J L.

description: Love Emmy's! Their bread is the best and the classic spaghetti and meatballs is classic for a reason!
author: Rochelle G.

description: This place makes going out for spaghetti worth it! Really delicious pasta and meatballs and huge portions. Great for a casual dinner spot with a divey vibe.
author: Rachel W.

description:
I came here with a friend in late March and Dana Marie was our waitress. She was the RUDEST server ever and I was never treated so badly in a restaurant before. She gave us attitude when I asked for separate checks - how hard is it to make a separate check? Just think of it like you're writing a whole new check for another table - are you that lazy and incompetent? While we were eating and nowhere finished, she asked if we wanted boxes. WE WERE STILL EATING. Then, she kept ignoring my friend who wanted more bread and was more interested in talking to the other waitstaff than actually doing her job, but FINALLY brought over bread and olive oil with balsamic vinegar. Due to a health concern, my friend couldn't have balsamic vinegar in her olive oil and Dana never came back with a new bowl of just olive oil so my friend got up and got it herself. Then after we were finally finishing up, Dana comes over without saying anything and literally snatches all our plates with such hostility and attitude while spilling the oil on the table and not bothering to clean it up. (The oil eventually made a trail because the tables were not leveled.) She also never came by to ask how our food was or how we were doing. We get your job is hard lady, but do ***NOT*** take it out on your fellow patrons. We even complained not even realizing Dana Marie was the manager (oh brother!) and not surprising, Dana never came around to apologize. I think that says a lot about her as a person. 

As far as the food goes, it's fine but nothing to really rave about. Their meatballs may be bigger but bigger doesn't always mean better - amirite?! Just because of Dana Marie, she ruined this whole experience for me. Never again.

I also agree with the menu - it's extremely hard to read because it's so amateur. It's not even nicely illustrated and the handwriting is not only awful penmanship but very illegible. What a huge turn off.
author: K. E.

description: It's in The Mission and has an alternative vibe to it. Unicorns and Dolly Parton posters help furnish the place. Tried the spaghetti and meatballs and it was very good. Tried the garlic bread and it was like eating croutons. Over cooked and dry. They also only have cans of soda. Glad we tried it, but for the cost we can go to more upscale places in Noe Valley.
author: David H.

description:
My husband and I finally got our asses in gear and visited Emmys Spaghetti shack 2 weeks ago. I wish we had been to the old shack before it closed, however we were lazy and never made it there. 

In any case we had a great dinner and a great time at the new Emmys! We ordered garlic bread, Cesar salad, spaghetti and meatballs, and tagliatelle with sausage and butternut squash (I think that was it). The tagliatelle was the least favorite. The meatballs/bread/salad were delicious! We also ordered some yummy peanut butter cup dessert which was to die for. We had an AMAZING bottle of Pinot noir, totally spacing on the name but it was delicious and a great price. The waitress was super helpful and friendly. I wish they still had a liquor license that allowed them to serve the hard stuff, but we found the selection of wine/beer to be fine for us. Plus, you can just head next door to the royal cuckoo for fancy drankzzz. 

We loved the picture booth in the back. Happy to add this restaurant to our neighborhood rotation!
author: Carolyn C.

description: One recent Monday, I decide to take the family down the hill to try out one of the new places on the Mission/Bernal corridor and they were both closed!  So we went to an old standby, Emmy's.  You take places like this for granted - good food, good service and fair prices.  The steak was awesome and spaghetti and meatballs are always great .
author: Timothy W.

description:
The steak... Omg, the Flat Iron Steak. Seasoned and cooked to perfection. I second-guessed myself after ordering a steak from "Spaghetti Shack", but I'm so happy I did. From the moment I walked into this place, I fell in love. The restaurant is so cute and the hand-drawn menus were a special touch. We sat at the bar because it was so busy, we couldn't get a table, but the bartender was really friendly and provided great service despite being incredibly busy. We ordered the garlic bread to start. Be sure to ask for a side of marinara because it doesn't automatically come with the garlic bread. You'll be glad you did, because it is delicious! The steak came with a side of sauteed vegetables with cilantro and some garlic, mashed potatoes. The potatoes were just like any other garlic, mashed potatoes, but the vegetables were sooo good. I was full after my steak, but had to finish my veggies anyway because they were just that good.

My partner ordered the Rasta Pasta. It was good, but my steak and vegetables won that round. We'll definitely be back!
author: Joseph K.

description: Best home made style spaghetti ever. I could not have been brought to a better place.  Although the service is very sub par.  If your going for food quality. 1000000% yes. If your going to be pampered and served I would get better or as equal service from a TGIFRIDAYS.
author: Michael D.

description: Emmy's is one of our favorite restaurants. Every time we have been there, the staff is rad and the food is delicious. We have brought out-of-town family here, we've been here on double date nights, and it has never disappointed. We may or may not have pictures from their leopard print photobooth covering our fridge at home. Also, as a weird side comment, their bathroom is nicely decorated and clean and I appreciate both of those things. Gold star!
author: Kaylene B.

description:
I'm a huge Emmy's fan. And the fact I can message now and get a reservation, amazing. Their spaghetti and meatballs are fantastic and our friends from out of town ask for them every time they are here

The chocolate peanut butter dessert is so good. I am not a huge dessert fan and I always want it, even when I'm way too full with the spaghetti and meatballs (see, I can't stop talking about them!)

It's a bummer that they don't have their liquor license yet, but, just one more thing to look forward to. 

Seriously people, you can make reservations now!! I love their new location. Go take a picture in their photo booth :-)
author: Emily N.

description: I loved the old Emmy's, it was cute & the food was always good. Went there tonight with a friend that went to the old place a lot as he lived a block away.  Today reservations at 6:45 pm on a Monday, 2 of us showed up on time to an almost empty restaurant to say our friend will be 30 mins late & we'll start w/out her.  The hostess was beyond rude & mean & said we don't normally do that. So I said well we'll sit at the (empty) bar or go somewhere else, she begrudgingly sat us. I get the not seating until your whole party is there, but not with an empty restaurant & a disclaimer, my friend is going to be over a 1/2 an hour, she lost her wallet, we'll start w/out her. Ok so that set the tone, the booth was really uncomfortable, like oddly not enough space for a normal person to sit on either side. We had wine & 2 apps, both were good.  My friend got there & had wine too & liked the appetizers.  In the end tho we left before dinner & sadly there's no way I'm ever going back to Emmy's.
author: Hannah k.

description: I have been coming here for over 5 years, they have seasonal specials which I've always looked forward to. I went a couple days ago with some friends to their new location which is nice and sat at the bar which gives you a prime view of the food being prepared which I love. The bartender was great, she was friendly and attentive. I ordered the Orecchiette broccoli rabe with pancetta in a cream sauce. The sauce was literally milk consistency, horrible representation of a cream sauce, and this happened last time I was there as well with another cream sauce pasta I had ordered, stick to the meatballs I guess cause they can't seem to make a cream sauce. The meatball sandwich was soggy and they cut the meatballs into these little slices so you aren't really getting the bang for ur buck, who slices meatballs multiple times? Disappointing .
author: maria c.

description:
Before their move, Emmy's used to be a really great spot to go out for an awesome cocktail and a plate of pretty good spaghetti and meatballs. One of the few kid-friendly drinking establishments where mom and dad could get their drink on while feeding the little ones. 

Those days are over, since they moved to their bigger new location, which lacks a liquor license. At the new location, the booths are squeezed in incredibly tight, so that even relatively slim adults will have trouble sitting down. 

And more importantly, there's no hard alcohol, so the cocktails are now uninspired fake drinks made under a wine and beer license. The spaghetti and meatballs are still decent, but now the drinks suck, and they sacrificed comfort for squeezing in an extra booth on each side of the room.

My last visit was, sadly my last visit. No doubt their Yelp ratings will live on for a while, based on the old location's awesomeness. But trust me, the old Emmy's is gone forever.
author: jack b.

description: the spaghetti and meatballs are fantastic.  the meatball sandwich is awful..don't order it.  the bread they use is really bad
author: Samir K.

description: The pasta comes out at just the right temperature and they really nail al dente. Stick to the classic here, spaghetti and meatballs is so common but so hard to get just right and they do. Portions are big so don't fill up on apps.
author: Andrew S.

description: The Girl with The Black hair was very rude. I would not go to this place just because of that. However, the spaghetti with meat balls was amazing. Do not forget to try the cheesy garlic bread as well!!! It was well decorated, but I can't stress enough how horrible the service was for my party 5+.
author: Phantom Era ..

description: Oh Emmy's, I love you! My husband and I have been coming to Emmy's for years, now, and have consistently loved it. Solid spaghetti and meatballs, awesome waitstaff, great atmosphere, excellent music on the sound system. The new location is bigger (but still has its ambiance) and has a pinball machine (yeah!). Always will be a favorite. Love y'all!
author: Mary Z.

description: Solid! Best spaghetti and meatballs... You cannot go wrong with this place...The salad was great too. Staff was on top of it.
author: Barney E.

description: I've been here a few times and I've been pleased with my experience every time.  I have had the meatball sandwich and Spaghetti with meatballs, both are super tasty.  The Orecchiette was rich and full of flavor with pancetta and asparagus.  YUMMMMM.  They moved to a new location and its roomier but still has the same cool feel.  ALSO - they have a photo booth in back by the bathrooms!!  That is super fun!
author: Jennifer T.

description: I would give 6 stars if I could. I always have such a fantastic experience and the food is consistent and delicious. I tried the zucchini noodles (zoodles) last night and they were incredible and surprisingly filling. The service is always on point, fun and helpful. I will continue to support this SF gem.
author: Leah P.

description: we have been going to Emmys gor years, but last night they failed badly. The meatballs and sauce were great as always. Soft tasty meatballs in fresh tasting marinara sauce can be a side, in a sandwich, or. with their signature spaghetti. The polenta however, was soupy, the short ribs undercooked and fatty, and the souvingon blanc- undrinkable. it's very noisy, and worth it to make reservations and avoid the line. Good service, as always, even though they were mobbed. Desserts are usually good, especially the root beer float. No one seemed to notice that the short rib and polenta order came back full, same with the wine.
author: Katherine F.

description: Good place. We had a nice meal here. The crab and zoodles was unique and tasty and the spaghetti and meatballs were yummy. We tried to order dessert but after waiting 20-30 minutes we got sick of waiting and cancelled the order. So that was a bit of a bummer but the main meal was good.
author: Rachel R.

description: Casual, fun ambiance. Delicious food - highly recommend the spaghetti and meatballs and the rasta pasta. Both are incredibly delicious, cooked perfectly and flavorful. However, I would skip the zoodles - $14 for zoodles without crab, $18 with crab. We had barely any crab in ours and thought that the entire dish was lacking. Overall, this place is not cheap but it's not outrageously priced, making it a good place to come with a group or solo!
author: Amy Y.

description:
Wife recommended this spot and our daughter loves spaghetti so I said why not! Have to feed the family right?

Let's just say this... MAYAN PRAWN CEVICHE?!? YES! I would literally go back just for this!
That with my BUNDABERG GINGER BEER? I'm good to go!

Not too fond of italian spaghetti so it's really hard for me to rate how it fares in general with other places, so I ordered the skirt steak instead (the only real non-spaghetti plate aside from the prawns that I noticed), and it was sub-par to me. Also ordered a mixed alcoholic beverage but didn't have an ingredient so I couldn't order it.

Let me say though, our waitress delivered A+ CUSTOMER SERVICE! Very attentive, helpful, and considerate especially with our needs with our little one with us and she boxed up our food to go! 

I'm willing to give this spot another chance and I'll most likely try something else but you can bet I'll be getting the MAYAN PRAWN CEVICHE!!! That was the TRUTH!!!
author: BA C.

description: Yeah, I know what you're thinking - what is a gluten free gal doing at a spaghetti shack?! Well, my friend loves this place, and I have actually accompanied her a few times.  Although the place does NOT have gluten free pasta, it has some other very tasty gluten free meals -- a few salads, and a steak entree, which are pretty good.  Add those options with excellent staff, and you got a winner! Will be back.
author: SinGlu V.

description:
I used to be a regular at ESS years back. Food was always great. 
Service was hit and miss most of the times till eventually it became just bad. 
3.5 years ago I decided to stop going there.
Why would I be giving money away to ungrateful, rude, nasty attitude, unappreciative SERVICE people like this.
But a few nights ago I decided to give them a try by placing a togo order. I thought: How bad can they be????
Well, they are just as bad as I remember them when it comes to their awful awful AWFUL service. 
So I decided to send them an email via Yelp's Contact this Business feature...
(cue in the crickets sounds...)
If you like well executed , basic food with a heaping dose of caca service, this is your place. Perhaps all the ink from the tattoos has gone to their head.
author: alex s.

description: My first review on yelp ( or anywhere else ) Emmys is worth taking the time to write a review and say some nice things. I went to the first location when it all started and we have been loyal meatball fans ever since!  The first place was a little small, but Emmy's finally solved the only thing someone could complain about ... they got More Space!!!! Their new location is awesome and their shrimp ceviche is now the only non spaghetti and meatball item that we order.  I don't have enough words to describe how good the spaghetti and meatballs are.  So instead i'll say that you should just eat them, and find out how great they are for yourself.   We've tried pretty much everything on the menu and all of it is worth trying!  Thanks Emmy's for many years of great food!!!
author: Ricardo O.

description:
I've been to Emmy's about 10 times over a 3 year period. I think that's pretty decent considering I live in the the Mission let alone the city itself... I don't go here for *Italian food. People please stop categorizing as Italian. It's good comfort food with Italian elements.  But NOT that good for the staff to always seem uninterested in me having a please come back experience. Maybe it's because I go after 7 mostly and they've had a long day...no, wait hey open at 5. 

Whether or not I'm accurate about the category it's in, I'm not mistaken that they could give a dam if I felt welcomed to come back, yet I've been there 10 times because there's just something about the local spot I feel like i should support. However I think tonight was my last time. 
Im too frustrated to break down minute by minute...the service. Just know that after trying to really like Emmy's I'm done waiting for them to appreciate my business. You would think new location....maybe some new, fun, "hey we're here now thanks for finding us" vibe. Dead. I don't expect them to know me specifically but it's a business and you're servicing people. Some new, some regulars, some bringing a friend. Being in a bigger space with more tables and just more; someone may want to figure out quick how to take the C+ food with C- service up a few grades or they'll be gone the like the least place that just closed up shop. You're not tucked in the "shack" anymore Emmy's, you're next to and across from places that give great service. Step it up please, because I'll most likely come back for one more try
author: Wild Style G.

description: I don't think there's much to say that hasn't already been said, but the spaghetti is great.  The garlic bread and the beet salad are also very good.
author: Daniel Q.

description: A bit salty for my taste. But, the food was delicious! We arrived later in the night, so it was not crowded at all. It was us and another couple that arrived after. This was my second time and so far I've had the spaghetti and meatballs and the Risotto. Would return again. Loved the decorations and the new location and it has so much more room. Waitress was friendly!
author: Patricia G.

description:
After my friend told me how good the spaghetti and meatballs were at this place, I decided I had to give it a try. So, I came here with said friend on a Sunday night. When we got there, we were told that there is a 15 minute wait and we were fine with that and the hostess told us that we could sit at the counter and order drinks while we waited. We waited for a bit, probably about 10 minutes and we were told that our table was ready. We got seated in a booth and given our menus.

After looking at the menu, I settled on the spaghetti with meatballs since my friend was raving about them. He, himself, got the orecchiette with pancetta and got garlic bread for starters.

The garlic bread left a lot to be desired, it had some garlic spread but not nearly enough and was hardly salted at all. My friend got his orecchiette before I got my spaghetti (i.e. they didn't come at the same time) and I don't really find that to be a big deal but I know it's bad serving etiquette.

My spaghetti and meatballs were okay for a little bit but the more I ate it, the more I disliked it. I think the problem came from the fact that it was fresh tomato sauce and so it was VERY acidic with each bite. I ended up having to resort to eating a remaining slice of garlic bread to cut some of the acid. The meatballs themselves were okay, it felt like they used too much filler and so it didn't taste as meaty as I imagined it should have been. Quite honestly, I struggled to finish the plate and I ended up having to get help from my friend.

My friend complained about how salty his orecchiette was but I didn't try it so I can't say from personal experience but I trust his judgement. During our entire meal, we didn't get checked in on once. It wasn't like the place was super busy and it wasn't that we needed anything in particular, but it's one of those things that we felt like that we weren't welcomed; it's a bit difficult to describe that feeling because it's not like they did anything in particular (really a more lack thereof) to make us feel that way.

Over all, I can't say I look forward to coming back. It's one of those places that I feel like that I would come back if someone wanted to come but it would not be a place I would suggest going to. The food wasn't pleasing, the service was pretty non-existent and kids were running around like they owned the place (I know, it's not the place's fault but it's not Chuck-E-Cheese either). Can't say I hate the place but I can't say I like it either.
author: Richard C.

description:
Excellent classic spaghetti and meatballs!
Great neighborhood place with homemade delicious food.
author: Craig G.

description:
I had never been to Emmy's even though I've lived in SF for 20 years, so was happy to finally have the opportunity to eat there this past Tues.
I'll start my review by saying that I'm 100% Italian, and have been surrounded by some of the best pasta in the world for most of my life, so I'm a stickler when it comes to Italian food.
I ordered the Brussels sprouts (my favorite veg) and was disappointed to discover that they ruined them up by adding some sicky-sweet glaze on them. They're advertised as *caramelized* which is the NATURAL process of the sugars coming out while cooking, and since BS's are just perfect naturally caramelized, to see that they in fact CANDIED them was a huge disappointment--it's SO HARD to make a Brussels sprout gross, but they managed to. 
Skip them if you like the natural flavor of a BS, order them if you like your veggies SWEET.
On to the pasta.
Of the 100's of cuts of pasta, I avoid spaghetti because it's the most *common* and for the $$, there's NO WAY to justify spending $14 on a plate of food that costs $1 to make--this is my general rule at ALL Italian restaurants--I get something more specialized or unique, but because I was sharing, ended up with the spaghetti and meat balls.
The pasta was cooked PERFECTLY--Italian style-aldente, which is REALLY hard to do (a +/-2 min window before going bad) so 1 star for the texture. 
The sauce was good, but not overwhelmingly so--glad that it wasn't sweet.  
Sadly, the Parmesan they use isn't terribly aged, so it's almost like putting shredded Mozzarella on your pasta, which for me is weird. 
The meatballs were good, but nothing to write home about either. 

Everyone talks about the HUGE portions, but they basically pile all the pasta on top of 3 generous meatballs so it looks like you get way more than you do. There literally is only about $0.75 worth of pasta (maybe 5oz), but with the meatballs, it's pretty filling.
I removed stars because of the limited menu (Hey, why not add a lasagna? It's cheap to make and goes a long way, too, which seems to be the vibe of this place) and because of the Brussels sprouts, and also because they TOOK AWAY the bread we were eating when the apps came--we had only eaten about 1/2, and 1/2 of us didn't even get apps, but as soon as the food came the plates and dip were whisked away--we didn't even notice until it was too late.

We had a GREAT waiter who looked JUST LIKE Justin Theroux, so that was a bounus, and I WILL return (really wanted to try the sausage alfredo dish), but it's NOT a place to go for value.

Sadly, I think that because the other space was so quirky and they were kind of a niche market, them moving to another place and having to compete with *regular sized* Italian places will be their undoing--it's WAY overpriced for what you get, and the food isn't SO tasty that it justifies the price.
author: D C.

description:
The two stars are for the bad service -- the food was very good. Again, the spaghetti and meatballs were delicious (meatballs were perfect), the focaccia bread was very fresh, and the green salad was very tasty and fresh. The dessert was yummy.

The not so good....

We were a party of four who arrived at 5:30 on a Saturday night -- the restaurant was virtually empty at the time with only one other table seated, so we assumed that the service would be speedy.

This place is NOT service with a smile. Unlike the wait staff, we are not hipsters, and we don't 'dress the part' so perhaps that worked against us, or might explain why our service was less than stellar. I'm assuming they don't know how to act around people who aren't wearing skin tight skinny jeans, tight flannel shirts and neon green aviator glasses with tattoo sleeves. Our waitress was not friendly and the service was sloooooooooow.

The entrees (all spaghetti & meatballs) took quite a while to arrive. Again, the other table that was seated already had their food so the cooks weren't cooking for any other tables We were seated toward the rear of the restaurant and noticed that throughout the meal the four waiters were huddled together, gossiping, and checking their phones. No one came over to check on us. We suspect that our food was ready pretty quickly but was sitting on the counter for quite some time while the wait staff chit chatted in the back.

After we finished the entrees, someone finally came around and we opted to order a dessert -- quite frankly, i was worried because by the time we ordered dessert the restaurant was quite full, and I knew that it was going to take forever to get it. We ordered the donut with ice cream on top -- should take about 2 minutes to put together. We timed it and it took 24 min to receive the dessert. All the while, some or all the waiters were in the back talking, laughing, gossiping and/or checking phones.

In the end, when the waitress brought our check she just placed it down on the table -- didn't smile, didn't say thank you, didn't ask if we didn't even joy the meal. Just slapped it down and walked away.
author: M. A.

description:
This place is everything you'd expect from a Spaghetti Shack (tomato-ey, meatbally heartiness) and so much more: simple, straightforward good good food. 
The pasta was cooked perfectly (thank you Boyfriend for always letting me taste all your food, sometimes multiple times.) 
I ordered the zucchini spaghetti (where the zucchini ARE the noodles) and it was garlicky, brothy and awesome. 
The one thing I want to say here is that while this place provides as much comfort food as you'd like (hurray!) you can also eat really healthy if that's what you are craving.
author: D Z.

description: Hard to beat...great service, awesome and consistent food, upgraded location. When we need Spaghetti, we go to Emmy's.  If you have kids, go early.  It gets crowded and hipsters without kids will give you the snide looks if your kid starts messing with them.
author: D D.

description: I love Emmys, it's been my go to for years. Delicious spaghetti, Caesar salad, cheese balls!! Yum! I love to sit at the bar, all the bartenders are so Hot: and welcoming. Awesome vibe at the new location, and photo booth in back!
author: Terry W.

description: Sorry Emmy born and raised in SF appreciate the bigger size and table availability but service not so great spaghetti and meatballs luckily are still main attraction... Good luck in 2016!
author: Bernard Z.

description: I love Emmy's Spaghetti Shack! It's one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  I always order the same thing - spaghetti & meatballs - and its amazing everytime! I don't even usually eat meat but I love Emmy's. They also have great wine and the service is great. They're very attentive and helpful.  I was able to make a reservation via text which was very convenient and they replied to text to confirm and my party was seated immediately upon arrival even though we were 15 minutes late.  I'm a huge fan!
author: ShayD E.

description:
Absolutely delicious food, great staff, super huge improvement from their other rinky location.  Can't say enough about their yummy food and staff . . . then why only 2 stars? 
Call me an old lady, but I kinda enjoy being able to hear a conversation with the person(s) sitting next to and across the table from me.
Seriously, their music was not only blaring loud, but the selection of music was hipster garage grunge and not appropriate at all to a dinner setting.  Granted, this is not a stuffy fine dining establishment and I'm not suggesting that elevator John Tesh would have been preferred, but there were 4 of us at dinner that evening and we all basically just ate in silence because yelling at each other was too unpleasant.  
In a club, the music should be center stage, but in a restaurant, it needs to be in the background.
As a side note, we did ask our waitress if it was possible to lower the volume a bit. She kinda laughed and said "oooh, but then you'd hear all the kitchen sounds".
I actually don't understand at all how the staff doesn't see the simple common sense behind this, as even they seem to have trouble hearing over the music.  The doll that sat us, could not hear us when we told her the other 2 in our party were parking the car and would  be in shortly.
The conversation between us and the waitress needed to be repeated several times just in the ordering process.  
If they have a hard time taking orders, wouldn't you think they'd take it upon themselves to turn the dang volume down?
Based on the dining experience that evening, I should just rate Emmy's one star.  The evening stunk! But . . . the food was delicious and my husband wants to order the spaghetti and meatballs again soon . .  this time it'll be TO GO!
author: bb b.

description: You like spaghetti and and three big meatballs? This place is for ya! I like to get a tall can and the spaghetti meatballs after a long days worth of work.
author: Daniel C.

description: Food is super good but 40s on the menu make the difference. The spaghetti and meatballs look legit. I had pappardelle with squash which was spiced well and bellisima! Look forward to coming back
author: Don G.

description: Must try: Spaghetti with meatballs and caesar salad
author: Lyna K.

description: LOVE IT!!! Everything is so good. Awesome environment, greta food, drinks and service and sooo clean. I want to eat here every night!! Thanks Emmy for gracing us with your BOMB food! :)
author: GiGi Rae R.

description: I'm very picky about my Italian food because nothing ever tastes the same as my mom's cooking, except this place. I can describe to you how delicious their spaghetti and meatballs are because you are going to have to come here and try it yourself! The staff is super friendly and the decorations are awesome!
author: Alicia Q.

description: Emmy's is merrrrr ferrrrrvret! Spaghetti w/meatball all the way. Somehow they always have The Smiths playing when I show up. Not sure how, not sure why, but it makes me happy. Not a great place if you're in a hurry (there's usually a wait), but well worth it and they have reservations now! Can't wait to try the new location.
author: Hillary L.

description: Worst food I've ever eaten.  Entree #1--spaghetti and meatballs--arrives WITHOUT THE MEATBALLS.  So I had to make something to go into the pasty spaghetti.  To make matters worse, you can't communicate directly with the restaurant because they have chosen to NOT list their phone number online.  Finally, I had to send an email to Caviar, who, after  1/2 hour, finally replied. Wait...It gets better...they offered to 'courier' the meatballs to us.  I was so fed up with the unacceptable food and difficulty and inability to contact the restaurant, I just told them to issue a refund for the spaghetti WITHOUT MEATBALLS that I had ordered.  The other entree, which was supposed to be PRAWNS WITH RISOTTO, ended up being a gooey, mess that had the consistency of Elmer's white glue, and, after much searching, *THREE* TINY SHRIMP--not 'prawns'.  Needless to say, we won't be ordering from this restaurant again
author: Carolyn M.

description: I have been eating here for years and it never gets old.  The spaghetti is yummy but the menu always has other exciting dishes which you should try too!  The cocktails are delicious and creative.  This place is unique and I love the ambiance...casual, fun, and good service.
author: Pickle S.

description:
