Love the spaghetti sauce, always will. Cesar: yum. Peanut butter bar: to die for!!

ok, 3 stars for 3 reasons:
1. new location, smaller portions
2. serving a salad course over a period of 10 minutes plus...that's just lazy. "Oh, the food will just trickle in." Lazy. Four of the six apps for the 7 of us were even the same salad...you'd think they'd come out together. First 2. pause 4 or 5 minutes. Then 1 more. pause another 3 or 4 minutes. Then the last salad. That makes no sense from any sense of giving good customer service OR making things work well in the kitchen. I TOTALLY get you're not fine dining. That doesn't make the diners more comfortable sitting there with 2 of 7 apps on the table ....for a LONG time.
3, and the reason that i'd go to the trouble of writing a negative-ish review: party of 7, 20% gratuity added. Awesome. Former server here. No complaints. I happen to LOVE gratuity being included. But then below that listing a suggested 18,19 and 20% gratuity on the already tip-included price?! that's kinda f*cked up. And i'm a former server and have gotten my fair share of double tips...but you include that message on both the bill AND the credit card slip. that is MESSED up and seems kinda fraudy. 
Emmy, I own my own business and I've almost never given a negative review...the gratuity thing? Makes me feel i'm going out of my way to support a business I like and they are rewarding me by trying to pick-pocket me (couple more drinks and i totally WOULD have double tipped!)

I'm really sorry for the negative review of a cool business in my 'hood... 

(ps: i wouldn't be yelping at all if you had an email address on your site!)
author: C. H.

description: The food is tastier than I remember. Nothing was left on the plate. Beet salad, linguini with muscles, steak and potatoes and a bottle of wine. Perfect night. Attentive service. Only con is that the tables are SO small and close together. I can't wait to come back though.
author: L B.

description: I crave these meatballs more than I care to admit.   Love the food, the vibe, the everything.    Pre-kids and post-kids it's still one of my go-to restaurants.
author: Oliver R.

description: Walked in. Sat at the bar. Left about 5 minutes later. While I know that all places may have a degree of a pest problem (let's not kid ourselves, folks), I'd like to imagine that they are not directly crawling all over the silverware that I'm a about to eat with or the napkin I'm going to wipe my face with. I silently watched a nice sized (and what turned out to be indestructible) roach crawl around while my friend ordered his food. I saw the bartender look over it twice without realizing, which made me wonder just how many of these things were dancing around the restaurant, unnoticed, at that given moment (lighting it pretty dim in there). At that point, I couldn't take it anymore and politely informed her of the little guy that was so eager to crawl over anything and everything in sight and grabbed my friend, regrettably leaving a very nice young woman to my left looking thoroughly repulsed at her partially eaten plate. If i had to guess, it remained that way.
author: Lena G.

description: Great room, great wait staff. The folks at our table enjoyed the pasta. But two of us ordered the steak. Huge mistake! Probably the worst I've ever been served. If I were the type, I would have sent it back. I was unable to cut into the steak without hitting white stringy rubber band like structures. I mean every cut everywhere on the steak. On top of how unappetizing that was, the meat was grossly over salted. Maybe a brined steak thing going on, but it wasn't on the menu. Also, thought the wine a tad expensive. Don't bother with the "personal carafe". Silly.
author: k m.

description:
Couldn't be happier! As always the servers are friendly , the food is solid and the prices are right. Emmy's is a what the San Francisco of yesteryear was. The city I grew up in. The city before techoles turned it into their personal frat house. 
Delicious honest food served up in an relaxed casual setting. In a city where that is disappearing I for one relish this " shack".
author: helen w.

description: So I just have to say as a chef whose helped run and start restaurants here in sf and now runs a restaurant in the east bay I just have to say that the food I was served here was absolutely unacceptable me personally as I chef I would never server a dish with such horrible quality the stacked Caesar salad was anything but stacked salad was made with romaine hearts with very little dressing I asked for extra and all I got was a 2oz cup with only a quarter of the cup full a Caesar salad served with no curtons or bread is just being cheap and with very little parm cheese is definitely not the standard the beet salad wasn't as bad but with a beet that is served almost half the size of an orange is being just lazy and makes it way to difficult for your client to eat and the fries which should have been something simple to achieve looked like they were just blanched off and not finished being fried to the nice golden crispy way a French fry should be finished as a chef myself i would not allow and find it very unacceptable for my staff to serve food with such bad representation of my kitchen as an over all I do not see myself or anyone else who loves and appreciates food to come back to such a bad representation of food and for being told we are busy was not a valid excuse because having only 5 tables seated with clients to any standard to someone in the same industry is definitely not considered busy!
author: Vincent C.

description: Food continues to be awesome and their waitstaff does a great job!  The new location is much larger and now you can make a reservation!!!  You can never go wrong with the spaghetti and meatballs.... And a Budweiser 40!!  Pasta and 40's always makes me happy.
author: William B.

description:
first time in the new location which did nothing for me. i liked the simple small odd old place.

the menu seemed more standardized; and drink oriented. i had the zoodles--spiralized zucchini-- as my main. pleasant enough but too much of a good thing. half way through i wanted something else. the shared romaine salad was fresh and tasty. my minestrone filled with beans swimming in a pleasant broth. the chocolate truffle cake, again shared, was a big hit (and actually the reason, i think, my friends decided to come back). linguini with mussels and clams produced three unopened clams while the steak eater happily cut and chomped away. 


i am not rushing back even if the chocolate cake is good.
author: Jt L.

description: Spaghetti with red sauce and meat balls should be simple and fantastic. Emmy's is the best in SF. It is that impossible balance of tomato, sweet and salty. The noodles are always cooked well. It is my go to in a pinch every time.
author: Michael J.

description: We enjoyed our meal here. It's nothing fancy, but it's perfect for a rainy day. If they have the minestrone, definitely get it!
author: squishy s.

description: Emmy's is one of the best neighborhood spots in the city! They have great good and super friendly service. You can't go wrong with the spaghetti and meatballs, and their salads usually knock it out of the park. They do a great job with their seasonal menu ingredients. And don't leave without getting dessert!
author: Wally B.

description: Emmys NEVER disappoints and now she has a bigger place to spread the love! Loving the new place with the same great great food and more!
author: Marcy K.

description: The concept is great, but I thought the food was only "ok". If you like spaghetti and meatballs, you'll like this. Stomach felt pretty ill afterwards for 24 hours, which is the reason for the 3 stars.
author: Sandra S.

description: Whenever I visit San Francisco I always make sure to hit this place up. Great food, super friendly service and awesome atmosphere.
author: Kate J.

description: Love Emmy's new place! Same great food and service, just a larger place!!  I usually get spaghetti and meatballs, but their other offerings are great too, such as the ceviche. Highly recommended!!
author: Ian H.

description: With the exception of the food, which was good, this place left for so much to be desired. Our party of five sat at the bar as we waited on our table. Not being much of a drinker, I asked the bartender for her take on certain drinks. She wasn't very friendly or responsive for the most part. Ended up ordering a drink, sat there and sipped on it as I watched her pour boxed sangria into glass bottles and refrigerate them. If you're taking boxed wine, dividing it up into glass bottles, and selling it for $20 a bottle, then you should at the very least do that in a more enclosed area so your customers don't see that. Found that to be tacky. Then, within seconds of being seated, a waitress approaches our table, without us calling her over, and says "I'm not your guys' waitress but I'll go get your guys' waitress and see if she wants to wait on you guys." Being throw off by such an awkward and unnecessary statement, all we thought to say was "ok, thanks." Also, we waited longer for our food than a number of folks who came in after us. In fact, we received our food right at closing time. They began turning off what little lights they had on as I was still eating. Here it was we waited quite some time for our plates, then feel rushed in having to finish them. We shared some of this feedback with our assigned waitress, who was apologetic, and I appreciate that... But even still, the food was good but not good enough to make me want to go back. There were a couple of friendly workers there but overall it was unwelcoming and awkward.
author: Julisa G.

description: I had their linguine clams and muscles. Tasted great... The first time round. Now I'm severely regretting my decision to eat here as food poisoning is making both sides of me very upset.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I've been to Emmy's 3 times now...twice at the new location. I brought my family to dinner this past Monday. We made a phone reservation and were seated after a 10 minute wait. We also waited a while for the server but we didn't mind because some of us work in the restaurant industry so we have loads of tolerance. The server( no name) was curt and actually made us feel like we inconvenienced her. We ordered food and beer without much dialogue from her highness...our waitress. I would have liked to ask if they had any tagliatelle but there was no time for that. She was so rushed. Another server brought out the appetizers. She was equally as rude and rushed. We enjoyed the garlic cheese bread, the beet salad and the mini mac...all very good! Then we waited. We could have ordered more beers if anyone had even come near or even glanced at our table. But they didn't. The food was dropped off after a good half hour in between apps and dinner. The first server came by and was surprised that we weren't eating. I saw her go to the computer where she may just have placed our orders. Eventually the food came. The orrichette was delicious and my son loved the meatball sando. The steak was blah. The "poppers" were nothing more than undercooked flavorless peppers with bland cheese. What a waste that was!! I don't think my family will want to go back! I will go just for that beet salad and mini mac but hopefully Emmy will get some one who can smile to wait on tables. A lot of people want a job. You don't have to keep negative people working there!!
author: Sage K.

description: Emmy's has a really great atmosphere. Service is kind and courteous, and there's a great selection of food. i got the spaghetti and it was good. The sangria is also pretty great and they have a larger selection of cocktails which looked fun. I will say that I can't read the menu for the life of me but that would be my only complaint! I didn't get to try the photobooth but liked that it was there in the back along with some old school arcade games.
author: Maria J.

description: After coming here for a very long time with friends of mine, tonight was my last time. I got there a bit early so sat at the bar and ordered a beer, and the bartender said barely 2 words to me. I am not looking for someone to be my best friend, but a "hey, how's it going?" From a bartender is not asking much. I sat there and drank my beer until my friends showed up, and when we tried to sit down, I was told I had to close my tab before they could seat us, guess transferring tabs is a little too advanced for these people. We order more drinks, an app, 3 mains, and desert. Food was ok, but we always came here because it had become a kind of tradition for us. After we finished our dessert our waitress came up to us and asked us to leave our table as they had "a lot of people waiting". I looked back and saw about 4 people waiting, hardly what I would call a long wait. I have never been asked to leave  a restaurant before because I was sitting at my table too long, and just Incase anyone is wondering, the 3 of us had been there for an hour and 20 mins, nothing crazy. After moving to this new location, this place seems to have lost all of its appeal. Rude service never lasts long in this city, so I would advise they get it together if they want to keep customers coming back.
author: Rebecca H.

description: parmesan is put on menu items that do not have jt listed-- if you dont like parmesan be sire to explicitly request they dont put any on.
author: Samantha D.

description: If you never been to Emmys you are missing out, everything m the menu is good but of course the spaghetti is amazing and I would recommend the Mac and cheese
author: Desiree B.
